Reviews.Title: “Luxery”
Reviews.Author: SilverFang13
Reviews.Content: Okura Amsterdam Hotel +++++ +Nice and clean. +The room was huge, with tv in the bathroom. +/- Its 20min of walking distance to the Holland Casino, pubs, shopping etc.

Reviews.Title: “High quality”
Reviews.Author: Matteo R
Reviews.Content: I spent an Easter Holiday at the Okura Hotel with my wife. The price is high but quality of rooms, service and food is excellent. The hotel is not in the center of Amsterdam but not much of an issue. The area is very calm (as opposed to the center of the city) and it take only a 10-15 minute walk or a couple of stops of tram to arrive to the main museums and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and 5 star service with some nickle and dime-ing”
Reviews.Author: ljchow
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, very friendly and helpful staff (Lex the concierge is great, housekeeping and front desk staff is extremely accommodating). Great fixtures and decor in the rooms, in-room expresso machine. We stayed in the lowest class room - standard, and it was still very luxurious, extremely clean, soothing decor with an excellent pillow menu! They are renovating so we were on the 16th floor and did not hear any construction noise. The location is a bit out of the central area but Amsterdam is so small it's a 15-20 minute walk to the Museum district or you can easily catch a tram to other parts of the city. Restaurants in the hotel (2 michelin rated rest. 1-2 stars) but we explored some nearby restaurants. We had a 40% discount rate thru jetsetter.com (160euro/$230USD). but Internet access was 15 euros per day, 6 euros per hour and there was a charge for the gym as well. Breakfast not included. At least by American standards, would have expected free internet and gym use at these rates. Apparently they are thinking about moving to free internet access next year, not sure about gym.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect but.......”
Reviews.Author: gucci48
Reviews.Content: Really clean & friendly, had a free upgrade, Suite 1909 on the executive floor is amazing, spent 4 nights here but never ate here as the prices are ridiculous, on our first night we had room service and there isn't alot (nothing really) for children but my daughter ordered chicken & pasta when it came it was 6 pasta shells with 6 slices of chicken for 24euros lol.......if they lowered their prices they would keep there customers in the hotel, also breakfast 30 euros per person for continental, we found Le Pain Quotidien a few minutes walk away was perfect and had breakfast there every morning less than 30euros for 3 people!! This hotel is not central, its about 30min walk to the centre, but trams are regular and taxi is about 20 euros, it was nice to get away from all the hustle and bustle and our suite was very large so it was lovely to come back and relax, there is also a supermarket opposite Le Pain Quotidien to buy your own wine and nibbles as you are talking about 40euros for a bottle at the hotel. Gym and pool is also extra and there is no free wii-fi

Reviews.Title: “Nearing Perfection”
Reviews.Author: AGVTokyoJapan
Reviews.Content: This is only my second ever positng of comments on Trip Advisor but feel this is such a special hotel, it deserves to be commended. In retrospect my stay at the Hotel Okura Amsterdam was closer to perfection than any hotel stay I can recall in recent years. A truly grand hotel, it is an expression of European tradition brought to contemporary life by a dedicated team of professionals. Inspired by the best of continental five star hotel tradition, it also offers a sophisticated touch of Japan in the form of Yamazato, a one star Michelin rated Japanese restaurant as well as arguably the best teppanyaki restaurant outside of Japan. Preparing for a dinner date with the 2 star Michelin Ciel Bleu that evening, I noticed from the pool area two chefs plucking berries and harvesting fresh vegetables in the hotel garden and immediately knew Ciel Bleu would not disappoint. Hints of Okura's Japanese roots appear in public areas from the ginko leaf motif on walls to the bizen pottery delicately on display. As I was preparing to leave, another two chefs were setting up an elaborate display of hand crafted Easter eggs in the lobby. Despite no doubt going through a number of refurbishements and additions over the years, the hotel evokes a remarkable sense of tranquility and consistency. My room functioned perfectly in every respect and the hotel staff could not be faulted. To boot, I purchased a pre paid euro 33 taxi voucher to transport me to Schipol, proving it's location definitely is convenient to both downtown and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Free upgrade, fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: Milesandmilesaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights recently. The room (618) was a free upgrade and I loved it! The tv screen in the bathroom with bbc1&2 as well as other English speaking channels made the trip!! The work being done on the 12th (?) floor was a bit noisy on the Monday morning- but we were warned and offered a different room. The breakfasts were good- champagne was a treat although I have had better cooked breakfasts. The poached eggs (requested) were super but the bacon was very overlooked. The location is a little out of town but the 25 tram was straight to city centre. The walk along the canal to the Van Gough museum was a pleasant 15 min stroll Service was excellent- even better then you'd expect in a 5 star hotel. Coffee machine in the room was the only disappointment- didn't seem to make the coffee hot! I really recommend this hotel. Especially as we had a 500+ euros a night room for just over Â£100!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel if possible”
Reviews.Author: bubba91
Reviews.Content: we booked a secret hotel on trip advisor not cheap 200 pounds sterling per night for a double room , what a dissapointment , rooms very average dated and a bit run down stains oin carpets and small. Foyer clincal and the hotel is for conferences/ buisness and not suitable for anything only work /meetings in my opinion. Location poor we spent 70 euro per day on taxis in and out of town. It is close to nothing. 23 floors in a remote suburban area I do not recommend this hotel. Breakfast 29 euro and poor quality after breakfast we wanted to sit out in garden, not allowed unless you buy another drink or food ( we had just had breakfast in hotel in a dark awful dinning room) No fresh air allowed at this hotel . We tired to cancel our booking when we realised the poor location manager at hotel refused to let us although last minute . com were happy to allow no wonder the hotle had seemd very empty not many folls like us prepared to pay the price ., He said we were upgarded but our room was poor for that price , we looked a prices for other 5 star hotels in city centre and they were less or similar however their location is far superior and standard higheras we have stayed in some before also and you have no taxi fares to pay as you can walk. We did not eat in restaurant at hotel as we were told by another resident it had no atmosphere and again was very expensive starters 30 euro . Overall if you are on a leisure, sightseeing, romatic, family trip avoid this hotel at all costs you will be dissapointed .

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelguide08186338
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Okura for a long weekend trip and really enjoyed the hotel. We booked the excecutive category as it was on offer. Thew lounge is on the top floor and gives you a fantastic view over Amsterdam. The Sazanka restaurant in the hotel was amazing and i highly recommend it. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with attention to details”
Reviews.Author: Renaissancewendy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Okura for 5 nights while attending a conference at the RAI. The hotel is a short walk away. We had a large corener room on the 19th floor with excellent views. And my favorite- the windows open! Hotel is quiet, except I kept hearing a bleating noise. I thought ducks in the canal don't do this--sure enough, a school nearby had sheep and goats in their yard--very charming. Back to the room--good bed, excellent lighting. Large desk with chairs on either side so that two people could work simultaneously. Bathroom was amazing. Huge with double sink, seperate tub and shower, seperate WC with of course, Japanese heated toilet seat. Very fast internet (bust pricey). Did not use gym or pool but heard the facilities are excellent. The lobby is lovely- very serence. Fabulous lighting fixtures in the public areas-- each a workk of art. Restaurants amazing. We did not eat at the Japanese. The cafe on ground floor was excellent. Had a great 3 course meu for 35 euros- a bargain. Not only did the food taste good, but presentation beautiful Ciel Blu was amazing--deserving of its Michelin stars. The executive lounge was a disappointment- very little to offer. Coffee all day. Wine & a few canapes in the evening. Certainly not like Asian hotels. That being said, go and enjoy. The restauruants

Reviews.Title: “5 star?”
Reviews.Author: mayfair74
Reviews.Content: booked through expedia last minute for 3 days. Much needed R+R. All good, lovely room, quiet, staff excellent. Very clean. Until.... the last morning, awoken at 8 am Damn! ( i never sleep in due to work)knock on the door daughter answered. Told her to put do not disturb sign. Awoken again at 9am maid. Did she not know how to read? First disruption was a note about window cleaning taking place that day!!!!!!!. Coudln't they have left the note the day before???? Second was the maid, the floor housekeeper supervisor was there outside the room with the maid when I went down for a smoke (who can sleep after being bothered by pounding on the door??) I asked her why we were disturbed when there was a do not disturb sign the poor maid chimed in to the supervisor 'you told me the room was empty'. This may sound petty but when you are paying over Â£100 at a supposedly 5 star hotel WHY!!!!!!!!also they did not refill coffee but told us to call room service 5 star uhh? No. 4 and a half maybe. beds are not very comfortable. but quiet neighborhood good security. Far away from the maddening crowds on a canal. easy acesss to town center on the 12 or 25 tram. Staff very polite excellent breakfast but not inexpensive or even reasonable but all in all 5 star food! I just wanted some sleep!!!!! Not my first time at this hotel good value for money. And they have a smoking room in the lobby so u dont have to brave the elements. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly went beyond my high expectations”
Reviews.Author: DviaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Here on business, hotel has a WOW boutique factor. Surprised to see an Okura outside of Asia, but hospitality of Asian style was greatly appreciated. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Somewhat Four Season's like, but with CHARACTER and CHARM, not cookie cutter or stuffy. Will ONLY stay here for business AND leisure. Hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location to the Rai”
Reviews.Author: twinklestar2307
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and close to the Rai if in Amsterdam on business, if you want to get to the central area its 2 trams, plenty of places to eat round about, the bar area is nice and but if expensive as is the restaurant. My room was very nice, large corner situation over looking a canal Would stay again if on business but not as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lyndo15
Reviews.Content: The Okura is a great hotel. The rooms were big and clean and even had a tv in the bathroom!! We were there for business so the hotels proximity to the RAI was great. The staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful. We had no issues whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Tokyo Shirokuma
Reviews.Content: I live in Tokyo and travel mostly in Asia. The level of service and hotel amenities are rarely matched in Europe or the US, but this hotel did it. The front desk and concierge staff are very helpful, the property clean and well-maintained, the rooms very comfortable, and the bathrooms proper. No shower-curtained tubs, rather all modern and spacious. Room service good, and not too overpriced. Response speed of housekeeping and room service was lightning quick. Breakfast each morning was just right with a variety of options beyond a continental, and the servers eternally cheerful and helpful. The neighborhood was quiet and residential, and the tram stop was only a 5 minute walk away, and riding the tram was one of the joys of being in Amsterdam. Yes, you could find hotels closer in to the city center, and they are charming, but they are dumpy and old in comparison to this hotel. The Okura seemed rather new. Cannot recommend highly enough. I've moved on to a new hotel in a different country in Europe, and I am sorely missing the Okura. I booked directly with the hotel web site, and was able to get a discounted pre-paid room, as well as pre-paid Internet and breakfasts, all at good discounts. Most importantly, I opted for the 10 Euro per night upgrade to a junior suite, and got it! My only two complaints: As a tourist, the very upscale and elite business clientele was a bit off-putting (talk about the 1%!). Also, the shower stalls always got water on the floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nina801
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and absolutely worthy of 5 stars. The room was amazing, spacious and luxurious, with an exceptional bathroom. There are several restaurants at the hotel, two of them have Michelin stars, but booking early in advance is necessary, so we did not get to try any of them. The location is good, with a tram stop about 200 meters away. The staff were welcoming and very service minded. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for a luxurious weekend in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: BagsParis_france
Reviews.Content: Based on three separate stays i can confidently say that this is a superb hotel in all respects. The quality of the rooms and especially the bathrooms is very high in size, materials and taste. Service is seamless form the reception greeting to housekeeping and room service. The restaurants are all among the best in Amsterdam. The pool is definitely the best hotel pool here. Only unfavourable detail. the executive lounge which is poor both in furnishings and in amenities and food/drinks.

Reviews.Title: “If there would be 6*, they would deserve it”
Reviews.Author: Josephine_k
Reviews.Content: Exceptional hotel, exceptional service. No wishes left. Excellent rooms from a design point of view, great idea with the bathroom in a glass cube (but with shaders). Verry nice view from the rooms. Excelent facilities through the whole hotel. But the staff is really what makes it perfect. Always ready to help, finding a solution, and fast in solving. Rooms were cleaned several times a day. It almost felt like someone was waiting around the corner until we went out and immediatelly, in 30 seconds, cleaned and made order in the room. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and convenience”
Reviews.Author: smferguson678
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Okura on the weekend of Amsterdam's worst weather for several years, and it was difficult to drag ourselves outside! The choice of four restaurants and two bars, the excellent pool/sauna/gym complex, and the beautifully furnished, luxurious room were almost too good to leave. Although it is located on the outskirts of the city, there is a convenient tram line just outside which gets to Centraal Station in 15 mins. I can't think of anything about this hotel which wasn't subtle or beautifully designed to help guests relax. Despite being a large 'business' hotel, service was attentive without being oppressive, and the executive room we had was equipped to the highest standard. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and our meal in La Serre restaurant was reasonably priced for an expensive city. We stayed on a last-minute deal, paying less than half price, and it's worth looking out for these as the hotel is not busy at wekends. Our deal included free access to the gym/pool/sauna. A couple of minor niggles which I hope the hotel can address - there are usually charges for the gym/pool/sauna and if I had been paying full price I would expect this to have been included. I also felt that they could have been more generous with the in-room coffee supplies; there were only six 'pods' for the coffee maker each day, and no milk or complimentary botled water. And why a charge for the wi-fi at this end of the market?

Reviews.Title: “Spacious well-conceived hotel”
Reviews.Author: abager
Reviews.Content: A beautifully designed hotel with excellent, friendly, and attentive service. Large rooms are well equipped with everything you might need. Some way from the centre, but easy to reach by tram. Good restaurants within walking distance. Well equipped fitness centre with large pool. A large hotel, but service is personal. Nothing to criticise!

Reviews.Title: “Okura Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mattwint2
Reviews.Content: Really high quality hotel, great attentive staff and service. My only gripes would be that the location is not central enough, but that's ok really as theres a regular tram stop right outside. But the really annoying part is that they charge for in-room wi-fi. These days I don't think that's acceptable! We pay enough for the rooms not to be charged this on top.

Reviews.Title: “6 days at the Okura”
Reviews.Author: Karen W
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference to attend in Amsterdam last Sept and we were put up at the Okura and we had a wonderful experience. Our room was fantastic with a lovely view and the staff were so friendly especially the bar staff. The cocktail bar had beautiful view at night and day and we ate pretty well averyday at Serres Restaurant at some stage or at least had a drink there. Don't miss Hinekin Factory and Ann Frank house. All very getable by tram stop near Hotel, and the bicycles are a must see. Also did a country side tour and the town of Edam is just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Simone M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Friendly staff, great rooms, close train station... I highly recommend you to get the executive suite. Great view, fantastic room and the bathroom is perfect! The restaurants are worth visiting!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the RAI”
Reviews.Author: poe.tuesday
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 night when visiting teh RAI The location was great, easy walking distance to the RAI and into Amsterdam centre - the latter was a bit far if tired so the tram was easy to find and get to and from the centre to the hotel and back I had a corner excutive room that was huge - the desk was as big as a bed! The room was very spacious, clean and plush - the bed was high up with loads of pillows - the room came with slippers, robe and lots of lovely things in the bathroom - the bathroom was amazing - huge bath with a tv, double sink and a seperate loo and shower that were like little rooms off the bathroom - the view from the room was not all that but I didnt care! My first night I was woken up at about 5am with the lights coming on and the curtains opening, obviously someone had set some sort of wake up but it had not be cancelled, this did shock me awake but once I have worked out what had gone on I got back to sleep quickly I did not have any meals in the hotel apart from room service on one occassion and it was amazing, the service and food was second to none - it was basically well posh! whilst I didnt spend much time at the hotel due to attending the RAI it was a great relief to get back to the hotel after a long day at the RAI I have no idea how much it cost as it was all paid for but I loved it there, whilst it may not be the most attractive hotel from the outside, it certainly is lovely inside and if you want to be spoilt then this is the place to do it

Reviews.Title: “just very very good”
Reviews.Author: cooldane
Reviews.Content: we spent a night in the hotel end of dec. I had found a good deal on internet. executive room with acces to the spa and incl. breakfast , it was a treat. Perfect from start to end . The very friendly lady at the reception ,who could see that we were staying at a low rate , still insisted on showing us the room at 22nd floor with a fantastic view. The room was every thing you could expect of a 5* hotel. The staff was excellent , discreet and friendly . only thing missing is a more casual coffeshop for a snack, we had a

Reviews.Title: “Luxury don't come cheap”
Reviews.Author: MrsCusack
Reviews.Content: A high end hotel with great facilities, ideal for getting to the RAI (exhibition centre) which is about 5 minutes' walk away. Rooms are spacious and very comfortable and I especially liked the TV in the bathroom and lights in the wardrobe. Within easy walk (or cycle ride) of a good selection of restaurants, bars etc but still relatively quietly located. Would certainly stay there again if someone else was paying!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great!”
Reviews.Author: Titamxnl
Reviews.Content: It's an expensive hotel but rooms are spacious and clean. Disliked the fact that you have to pay to use the gym and swiming pool. Had lunch in one of the restaurants and food was good. Had dinner at the sushi restaurant and we were amazed with the friendly service (not common in NL) and food is authentic and delicious. Decoration is lovely. Could notice that the customers (mainly locals) were too busy with other customers/tables (difficult to ignore). Still the place is worth the visit and reservation is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “expensive and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: libi050
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully decorated, with spacy rooms. The staff was very helpfull and always with a smile. Nice breakfast. The only downfall was the relatively high cost and the distance from the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellingTrio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near the centre of Amsterdam. Clean and stylish, is a good accommodation for both business and leisure travel. Our room was generously sized with a great view, with both cable and wireless internet available (at a charge), and a great bathroom with quality toiletry products. The breakfast choice isn't large but all the foods served are very fresh and high quality. This is a hotel that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service & Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Lynnvill
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel. The best service I have ever received in a business hotel. Special thanks to Maki at the front desk and Philip van Maaren. Rooms are beautiful and well appointed, TV services and in-room movies are the latest and with plenty of choices. Food outstanding - not just in the famed Japanese restaurant - but room service quality and service is very good. Drawbacks - they need more Japanese food in the room service menu rather than Japanese curry. Also internet should be free.

Reviews.Title: “amsterdam in style”
Reviews.Author: elena52
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Okura for 1 night last weekend with 2 couples in a luxury room. I was the first who arrived and I told the reception that my husband and the other couple were about to arrive. I checked in and everything went fine. My husband arrived a bit later and we had a very nice dinner in the Serre restaurant, although the atmosphere was very ( too) noisy. When we returned to our room it was only prepared for the night for one person ( detail, but I told the reception-desk before that my husband would arrive a bit later...to be honest he did'nt tell the reception that he arrived, but after all I made the reservation for two ;)) The room was perfectly clean, very well kept and nice and tastefull decorated. We went upstairs for champagne n the bar with the other couple that just arrived and we had a wonderful end of the evening together with beautiful views of Amsterdam. The staff was very friendly too. Breakfast was nice, rather expensive, buth nothing special or it must have been the mushroom Japanese soup ( we didn't taste the soup). The other couple told us the other morning that they had some problem with the absence of a hairdryer ( there was no hair dryer in their room ( 1407 ). In my opinion very weird for a 5 star hotel or am I wrong? On the other hand: we had the room next to them and we had no problems. Our friends also asked the frontdesk for something to upload their I-phone but there was nothing available at that moment. Then they had to go to minus 1 level to recharge their phones but that turned out to be no solution. We had lunch at Yamazato, wonderful experience and compliments for the whole staff! After all a stay in luxury and style and our compliments for the nice Christmas 2011 decoration.

Reviews.Title: “too many rules”
Reviews.Author: mikec-edinburgh
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights recently, room excellent however far too many rules for me not allowed a burger in the bar. you have to order it through room service and eat it in your room, not allowed to take it from your room to the bar, stupid really stupid rule. The Toilet, its worth booking just to see the toilet (it has electronic controls, god knows what they do????) left the toilet confused, left the hotel confused, as to all the rules, not for me never again, nice clean room (probably cleaner than an NHS Hospital) would I go back!! NO

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Vickaly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights in total, 2 for leisure over the weekend and 2 for work purposes. The hotel itself is 15minutes from the airport, although a taxi will cost you about 40 Euros! The hotel is lovely inside, and my room although I would consider quite small for a "deluxe" was perfectly comfortable. The bed was soft and fluffy, however my favourite thing about this hotel was the bathroom, which was really lovely with a big showerhead, although the shower was designed a bit silly as it was not raised this caused a lot of water from the shower to run onto the bathroom floor. The bath was really spacious and there was only a glass seperating the room which meant you could watch TV while you bathed which was quite nice :) There was also a lovely Nespresso machine in the room, but only creamer was provided which made the coffee taste a little strange... I did also find it a little inconvenient of not having a kettle in the room at all. The hotel had 3 pin plugs which is quite thoughtful of travellers who might have forgotten their adapters. I also ate in the Michelin star Japanese restaurant, which was delicious and sat at the sushi bar where authentic japanese chef prepared sushi. In all I did enjoy the stay here, although the breakfast at 30 Euros appears to be a little overpriced for what was on offer especially as the scrambled eggs tasted horrible! The staff in general were polite and friendly, although it is suggested that the doorman should ask customers to stay inside when waiting for a Taxi rather than directing them outside to wait in the cold whilst a taxi is called! The hotel is also very close to a tram station called Cornelius, which is useful and only about 10-15minutes ride out to the Dam, which is in central Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here on our wedding night and it was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: JD_NL
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly, we got a room that was even better than the one we made a reservation for and breakfast was also great. We live in Amsterdam so could have stayed home but I'm glad we went to the Okura instead. Thanks for a wonderful night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Brian W
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 1 night, I got a good deal from lastminute.com with this being a topsecret hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room a good size, latge bathroom with bath (with tv in the wall) and big shower. The breakfast was great and I also used the spa which was very nice. After checking in we got a taxi outside the hotel Dam square which was a bit expensive at 20 euros (it was only 10 on the way back). Internet was not free either, other than that, everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AV_Surrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights and this was a fantastic hotel I must say. Very friendly and efficient staff, well appointed rooms and handy location. The bar on the top floor was very modern yet with a relaxed atmosphere. First rate hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “World demolition Awards 2011”
Reviews.Author: DemolitionEngineer
Reviews.Content: Having been short listed for the World Demolition Awards 2011, we stayed only the one night for the award ceromony. Set in the heart of Amsterdam by the side of a a canal it is very convient. The company booked a number of rooms for the event, all report the rooms to be modern, clean and tidy with clean fresh linen, although small for the price. One couple within our group were given a free upgrade and reported this to be very good, the extra space making a big difference. Being in the heart of Amsterdam the bars and Cafes are close to hand should you wish to view the city and its sights: Unfortuantly our tight schedule prevented much exploration or sightseeing. The Awards were held in baquetting hall within the hotel and saw around 300-400 delgates from all round the world attending. Catering for that many people is always difficult and the hotel coped well. The food was nouvelle cuisine style, set over 4 courses. Quality, flavour, texture and presentation of the meal was excellent, if not to everyone's taste. Divation from the set menu was by request only, but this ensured the meal was delivered professionally. In conclusion: The Okura is a high quality hotel offering and excellent service: But dont expect to get this level of cheap - you pay for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: theWrightster
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a superior room which was superb. The staff were very helpful at all junctures. Best of all the bar on the top floor has stunning views across the city, is stylish and serves a mean bloody mary. I was only there for 1 night but can recommend it very highly.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with fantastic restuarants and facilities”
Reviews.Author: LozKnowles
Reviews.Content: Not the cheapest hotel in Amsterdam but with 2 Michelin starred restaurants (the Ciel Bleu having 2 itself) and great service it really is an oasis in such a vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but good food, good rooms, close to town center, airport and transportation.”
Reviews.Author: pekopper
Reviews.Content: The food is outstanding. Rooms are comfortable, beds moderate in firmness, typical European comforter for a bed covering. Cleaning is V E R Y pricey. 9.75 Euros for a shirt (About $15 US), yes "A" shirt. If you have to do laundry, a landermat is about 4 blocks away. Out the hotel, 3 blocks right, one ore right. 6 Euros, wash and dry for a load. Excellant gym, sauna and pool. Attendant in attendance who is also a physical trainer.

Reviews.Title: “Oao, the taste of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Stig M
Reviews.Content: Got a top secret deal from last minute.com. A little more expensive than usual, but after we understand why. We had a weekend in luxury. Me and my girlfriend was there to party for a weekend. I have never been to a hotell of this class. We had a massive room overlooking Amsterdam, we had full access to a beautiful spa, we ordered room service once, it was expensive, but the food was of a different class. It was lovely. We will defintly go here again. It was a little outside town, and there was an extra cost for the weekend with taxis, but still. Defintly reccomended to spoil yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: KevANDHayley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with my wife as part of a business Trip. As a hotel itself I dont really have much in the way of complaints as the place is kept very clean and tidy (though you would expect nothign less from a 5 star). My main issue was that it was very over-priced. Luckily it was a work trip, but I really dont feel a 5* hotel should still be charging you for extra's such as Breakfast/Gym/Wi-fi...... I'm sure we could have booked B&B but to me this should be standard on all bookings, as should access to their amenities. Ultimately the room rate for 5 star properties is already much higher, so to be expected to pay around â‚¬75-â‚¬100 a night extra just to get onto the web, use the gym and have breakfast is in my opinion a bit of a joke. When i enquired about late check out i was told i'd need to pay 50% of the standard room rate, which would have meant paying â‚¬175 to check out 6 hour later!! On the flip sode they hotel is very nice and the facilites (once paid for) are of great quality. It also has several really good restaurants and a nice roof bar........ Next time I 'm in Amsterdam though I'll definitely look to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “You will not find a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cillablay
Reviews.Content: I totally enjoyed my stay at the okura. It is well worth it's five star status. Very impressed

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel - not near the city centre but easily accessible enough”
Reviews.Author: Rex_raccoon
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel that is walking distance to the major attractions - nope, this is not it. I would think that most people who stay here are business travelers who need to attend events at the nearby RAI. It's only a pleasant 10-min walk (or less) to the RAI - cross a little bridge on your left and walk straight down. By tram, it's easy enough to get around town - #12 to the Museum Quartier and #25 to Dam Square area. You can even buy a 24-hour or 48-hour tram pass at the concierge for unlimited tram rides - very convenient. There's an Albert Heijn supermarket about 10 mins away; there are also some eateries along the path to the RAI. The hotel serves a sufficient Continental breakfast - cold cuts, breads, bacon, eggs, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, juices etc. The hotel room is nice and spacious - perfectly fine for a business traveler. The bar / restaurant upstairs is supposed to be really good apparently, but didn't try it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant luxury well placed for RAI”
Reviews.Author: TSM2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an upgraded deluxe room for three nights and enjoyed the time I spent here. Room and bed very comfortable. Separate shower well received. Loads of drawers and hanging space too which was a real bonus. Staff helpful all the time. Breakfast overpriced but very enjoyable. Top floor cocktail lounge offered great views over Amsterdam along with some very lovely drinks! Ate out one night at the nearby Brasserie Richard which was also very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “modern and classy”
Reviews.Author: eyy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we attended a conference. It is very near the convention center about 10 minutes walk. If you wish to take the train from Schipol airport, Take the train up to Central Station and from there take Tram 25 it will take you to the hotel. Front desk are so accomodating and Concierge people are so helpful when it comes to direction. Our room was very modern and huge, with a flat screen tv complete with minibar and expresso machine. We have an all glass bathroom which was very neat and clean. If you brought your laptop you can easily hook it up with an average charge of 12 euro / day. We were lucky to be given an Executive floor which can also give you an access to their Executive Lounge where you can use their desktop with Internet service and printer for free. The Lounge also serve tea/coffee and other drinks and cookies and is open from 7am to 10 pm. Amenities is of 5 star and they serve great buffet breakfast except that you have the same breakfast everyday. They also have a Japanese restaurant which is a little bit pricey but the food was great with authentic Japanese server which explain to the guest each course. A French restaurant which is very strict in punctuality, they will cancel your reservation if you are late. One of our friend left her money (Dollars and Euro) on top of the table of her room. When she got back from the convention, she was surprised that she had left her money but when she checked it, not one cent were missing. She was all praised with the honesty of housekeeping. This gave the group a very nice impression of this hotel. Going around is not so hard except that you should alot about 20 minutes to get to the city center. Outside the hotel near Savoy hotel you can easily take the tram. You can purchase your 24 hours ticket at 7 euro or 48 hours ticket at 12euro from the hotel concierge before boarding. In case you forgot you can just pay the fare at 2.60 euro to the driver for one way. Tram 25 will bring you up to the Central station and Tram 12 will bring you to Van Gogh museum. Just ask for a map from the hotel concierge and you will see all the Tram numbers and its route which is very easy. Getting back is a breeze just go to the opposite side where you get off and it will bring you back to your hotel. Or you can just check the tram stop if the tram number you wish to take would pass that stop or not. There are only few shops near the hotel and few restaurants. Ikea is very near just beside the convention center. Tram 4 goes from the convention center to the Central Station. If shopping is what you wish just go to DAM square and near Royal Palace there are a lots of souvenir and specialty shops. You can also take an Hop on hop off bus near the Central station and Red Light district is also near the station. For last minute shopper, go early to the airport . After check-in for your next flight, and if you still got ample time, go to the arrival area you will find lots of shops which is sometimes cheaper than downtown. Just keep track of your boarding time. Schipol airport also got lots of duty free shops which offer lots of great deals.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: RBRSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this week for a conference at RAI and it is very close (10 minutes walking). The location is excellent, since it is in a nice neighborhood, beside a channel, with many restaurants on the way to RAI (on Scheldestraat) and also on the other direction (on Ferdinand Bolstraat). A good Thai restaurant is nearby (Naan Naam), but it is on the opposite street (Maasstraat). Ferdinand Bolstraat also has a nice bakery (Le Pain Quotidien) and also a good supermarket (Albert Heijn) just across it. The supermarket has a small entrance, but inside is quite big and with plenty of products. There is a liquor store (Gall & Gall) inside the supermarket (with wines, beers, etc.) There are about 3 tram stations near the hotel, that makes it easy to go to the downtown area. Ticket is 2.60 Euro one way or 7 Euros for the whole day. The hotel is very nice. I stayed in an Executive room on a high floor, just at the corner of the building (so, I had views from 2 sides! - see attached photos). This is the only tall building in the area so the view is great! The Executive Lounge (22nd floor) is also nice (I also added some photos), and has soft drinks, juices and water + fruits during the day. At the end of afternoon there are also some beers (Belgium, Japanese and Dutch) + wines (one red and one white). The lounge also has a Nespresso machine (larger than the ones in the rooms). The drawbacks of this lounge are that it has only one computer + printer and there is never ice in the ice container (I complained about the ice for about 4-5 times). Internet connection is by cable in the rooms and wireless in the public areas (1 hour = 6 Euros and 24 h = 12 Euros). I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “THE best!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgul
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here when we attended a conference near the hotel. When we made the reservations, the representative said the hotel is walking distance from the train station so we don't have to worry about a taxi. So, my husband and I took her word and walked from the RAI station to the hotel with two suitcases and a backpack. Not even quarter way into our walk, it started to rain. Taxi drivers did not want to take us to the hotel because of the close distance - We had already walked to the RAI. So we sucked it up and kept walking. Yes, WITHOUT luggage, the walk is a mere 10-15 minutes. WITH luggage, it was LONG and FAR. By the time we arrived at the hotel, we both were drenching wet and extremely exhausted. Not to mention irritated that the reservation representative at the hotel did not consider the fact that we will have luggage when we arrive and not to instruct us to walk. Aside from THAT, we had an amazing stay. The staff was very knowledgeable and always available if we had a question about sightseeing or local restaurants. The room is equipped with a Nespresso maker, flat screen TV with a HDMI connector, and a few channels in english. The HDMI connector was great - i was able to connect my iPad to it and watch movies. One night, it was extremely warm in the room and I requested a fan. The staff brought it up immediately and turned down the temp of our room to make it cooler. The towels were also superb quality. There is also a tram station close to the hotel that takes you into town such as Dam Square (red light district). It was extremely convenient. Oh! Since the hotel is right next to a canal, there is a sightseeing boat rental right behind the hotel. It's not expensive at all. The hotel has 4 restaurants, i think, and the prices are decent. Overall, great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant elegance”
Reviews.Author: syrah_fan_69
Reviews.Content: I stayed one short night at the Hotel Okura during early September 2011. I was both pleasantly surprised by the caliber of the hotel and the amenities of the neighborhood nearby. Just a few blocks from the hotel (less than 5 minutes walk) on Schelderstraat is a couple of blocks of great restaurants (we ate good pizza, and had excellent ice cream from an ice cream place there) not choosing the steak place, the Thai restaurant or half a dozen other good looking and smelling options. Like one of the other reviewers here, I received an upgrade upon my arrival. Mine was because there was some sort of maintenance issue in my assigned room, and when they could not resolve the problem an upgrade was the result. I found the junior suite very generously sized, with an excellent bathroom (with the high tech/fancy Japanese toilet seat), a comfortable bed, nice furniture and a high quality flat-screen television. I was there for too short a time to eat in any of the restaurants in the hotel, but would gladly stay again and explore in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lastminute's Secret Hotel - But a fabulous one at that....”
Reviews.Author: Belfast-Will1975
Reviews.Content: I recently booked this hotel as Lastminute's TOP SECRET hotel, I recieved an executive room with use of Spa and Breakfast included. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, Immaculate and the service received was of an extremely high order. They honestly could not do enough for my partner and I. The restaurants are expensive yes, but you are getting 2 x Michelin starred quality food and the service is impeccable. The 23rd floor Bar is a must visit, stunning views of Amsterdam in three directions. The room was superb, including Tv in bathroom! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any traveller. The spa is pure luxury and includes sunbeds should the notion take you. The only issue I would have is for Leisure travellers, as it is a good 15/20 minutes by Tram into Dam Square (or 15Euro in a cab) . I would say that it would take a good 45/60 minute walk to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizzieBGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip. What a beautiful hotel. So clean and sparkly. The staff were wonderful. Definitely worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Netherlands: this wonderful stage multicolor”
Reviews.Author: Yohnpaul
Reviews.Content: Unforgettable warmth and the welcome given to the guest. Structure from the very attractive value for money

Reviews.Title: “Okura was a great experience...”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at Okura in august 2011. It was an absolutely beautiful and stylish hotel, the staff was very professional and helpful, and we had only the poor hairdryer in the hotel room to complain about. The beds were fantastic, the decoration was very nice and the bathroom overwhelming. The centre can be reached at about 10-15 minutes on bicycle, which is no problem at all. We rented super bikes from MacBike at about 8-10 euros pr. day. Amsterdam should really be experienced from a bicycle! A much more free and fun way to explore the city than sitting in a tram. I would definately recommend staying at Okura. We got a great deal at Hotelsclick.com, so look out for great offers on their site (in opposition to hotels.com). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “we like it, but we don't come back....”
Reviews.Author: petunia17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Okura two weeks ago. The Hotel is located very far (15-20 euros of taxi to Leidseplein) from downtown, and take the bus -2,60 euros for a ticket- weren't less expensive for us. (we are five) A day, we walked to Leidseplein, and we arrived there in 45 minutes. The Hotel is a very good hotel, all the people worked there were extremely kind and helpful with us. The rooms are large and spacious, with good furniture and excellent beds, but the bathroom furniture were a little old...and in the rooms NescafÃ¨ machine were out of work, and the fitness room and the pool were an extra cost. A good hotel but too far from downtown to come back another time.

Reviews.Title: “Complaint about the hotel - really annoyed!!”
Reviews.Author: JIgyasaBajaj
Reviews.Content: Complaint about the hotel - really annoyed!! We have made a hotel booking through booking.com at Hotel Okura in Amsterdam. This booking was made along with many other bookings for my recent Europe trip. Because of change in my visa dates, I had to cancel this booking and I replaced it with another hotel because Hotel Okura was not available on those dates. To my surprise, while I was in Amsterdam, I got a mail that I have been charged by Hotel Okura for one night for Euro 167, which is towards no show. When I called booking.com, they simply took no responsibility and just forwarded me the hotel details to speak with. They told me that I have rebooked this hotel on the same dates again, which I never did and booking.com or the hotel Okura management staff has not been able to provide me any proof of the booking also. Well even if they provide, I have no mail so far and I am 100% sure that I have not made any rebooking on the same hotel for the same dates, because my date of travel to Amsterdam were already changed.No one in the hotel is bothered to reply or ideally send us the reservation confirmation they are claiming or else simply return our money back !

Reviews.Title: “Calm Japanese Experience”
Reviews.Author: CSMEXBOL
Reviews.Content: Just had my stay with this nice hotel. The standard room was clean and nicely decorated. The service in general very friendly and helpful. The location is great for those who need a calm night away from the noise of the city center. The hotel is nevertheless very well conected with places such as the Museums and main touristic places near the Dam. The food in the restaurants is also very good and is cute to see the japanese waitresses in traditional clothes. The only inconvenient for me is that the breakfast does not have the choice for low fat products which I did find in other 5 star hotels. Therefore, of the two nights I stayed there, I took the breakfast only once. Otherwise it is worth trying this Japanese experience in Amsterdam ... and don't forget to try the chinese massage in the streets. Very good.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: WencheOslo_Norway
Reviews.Content: We had an executive room in the 19th floor with wonderful view over Amsterdam and the canal besides the hotel. Beautiful japanese design, including a japanese park and pond with carps. Easy to take the tram to the center and the museum areas. The outdoor restaurant was besides the canal, but the serving of food was unfortunately very slow. The reception / counsiliere was very helpful getting informasjon and tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and close to public transport and center”
Reviews.Author: kenk10
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent room, on the 16th floor, overlooking the canal. Nice bathroom with a glass wall that separates it from the bedroom. Great shower and very good bed. It's not cheap but it's a very decent hotel. (avg price was approx 160 eur/night) This excludes parking (35 EUR/day). Parking is expensive everywhere in Amsterdam. Location was fabulous, taxi's are around 24/24, public transport is only 200 meters "far". Even walking to the city (through the nice neighbourhoods) is not a problem. (15-20 min. walk) Great hotel, good service and very friendly people. Negatives? Yes, no free wifi.. (not in room and not in the public areas) The restaurant and cocktail bar on the 23rd floor was closed (until somewhere near the end of august), too bad this is not mentioned on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claesson
Reviews.Content: 15 - 20 min walk from downtown, but modern and classy hotel. Nice room. We booked ours through Hotels.com and were asked the (inevitable) question on check-in if we wanted to pay a surcharge and "upgrade" to a recently refurbished room. We did and it was very nice. A cool feature was the glass partition wall between the bathroom and bedroom that gave unobstructed views from the tub. Fantastic breakfast, not included (expensive).

Reviews.Title: “it would be an excellent 4 stars hotel; but it is an average 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Carlo P
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel: nobody will deny that. Everything is almost (but never completely) perfect: and from an hotel which asks around 500 euro per night, to be honest, one can demand perfection. Some examples: evrything - a part from the cofee - is an extra: parking, breakfast, spa, shuttle to the airport, bike rental etc... Breakfast is very good but limited. All in all, it would be an excellent 4 stars hotel; but it is an average 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dandjm
Reviews.Content: from the outside to the lobby and to the room. first impression YES 5 star Then, room not cleaned properly, coffee machine didn't work, asked for it to be fixed but had to ask again after an obvious abortive attempt, neither the coffee supply nor the mini bar had been attended to after the previous occupant. it was only on our third night the room had an evening visit to turn the bed down and leave a breakfast in- room menu All small but not trivial points but not what expected from an hotel marketing itself as 5 star

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinarily high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: GREG44NYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an optimal location for work at the RAI convention center. Since amsterdam is a relatively small city (in area), it's also reasonable to walk or take trams for sight-seeing as well, though this probably wouldn't be your first choice. The quality of the rooms and the service at this hotel is top rate. I had an executive room. It had remote control lights, curtains, and (of course) television. Great desk with comfortable chair for work. Nespresso machine. Well-designed and beautiful bathroom with two sinks, tub, and separate shower. Rooms were well-built and sufficiently soundproofed that, while in my room, i never heard another guest during the week i was there. Hotel staff couldn't have been more friendly at every encounter.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Maja05
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice, with spacious rooms and five star service. The only thing that we did not like was the fact that the hotel was really far from the city center. We always like to do the sightseeing by foot and also go out in the evening. We had to walk to the city center for 30 to 45 minutes. The museums are a little bit closer (20 minutes walk). i would not chose this hotel for sightseeing, except if you use a tram or a car.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Close to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: ccmacy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Very happy with this hotel, though a bit pricey. Room was very clean, nice linens, turndown service. The bathtub was wonderful- nice and deep! Amenities were nice- fancy coffee maker, tea, etc was complimentary. They gave me a corner room on the 9th floor and the view was wonderful- It's an easy walk to the convention center with lots of cafes along the way. I felt very safe walking alone here, even at night. Staff are very nice and helpful, the bar at the top is great. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but pricey extras”
Reviews.Author: samgees
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Okura for three nights 16th - 19th July. We booked a standard room at 153 euros per night and at check-in without asking we were given an upgraded superior room, which had been newly refurbished. The room was fantastic, very comfortable and clean and we really enjoyed our stay. The staff were friendly and very helpful at every level. The extras were however expensive - perhaps no different to other 5 star hotels but they were expensive nevertheless. WiFi in the room (or wired, for that matter) was 6 euros per hour or there was a daily rate. We did make use of our mini bar but after the second day it wasn't restocked, and when we checked out they asked us what we had as there were "charges showing on our bill" but they weren't itemised. They then called to ask someone to check our room to see exactly what we had while we waited a few minutes at reception. The items were placed on our invoice as "mini-bar" or something like that but with no breakdown so it was qute difficult for us to clarify whether this was correct or not so I just agreed it, although in hindsight I do think we were possibly charged 30 euros + incorrectly. I would certainly stay again, we very much enjoyed our stay and I definitely recommend this hotel provided you watch what you're paying! (if you need to, that is....)

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMPeterson
Reviews.Content: We had a really lovely stay at the Okura Amsterdam. We had a junior suite on a high floor so we had very expansive views, but there wasn't anything all that spectacular to see. The room was very big and spacious with lots of nice touches. We loved that we could control the room lighting, temperature and other things from the bedside remotes. The bathroom was very nice and had the best bathroom storage I've ever experienced in a hotel of any class; it was more like a vanity you would have at home with two sinks, a huge mirror and several drawers. The tub and shower were separate. The toilet has a washlet system with a heated seat and the built in bidet. The check in and out was smooth with pleasant hotel staff. The concierge was very helpful giving us lots of advice about using the trams, where to go and how to get there. The breakfast buffet was great and included in our room rate. It had lots and lots of choices and had both hot and cold items, was pretty typical of what you would expect at a nice European hotel with a few added extras. The location might seem a little far out of the center of the city, however, there is a tram stop very near the hotel that can take you quickly to the city. However, we also walked there several times and it probably took about 20 - 30 minutes. We had dinner at Yamazato, a traditional Japanese restaurant, one of the nights of our stay and it was OUTSTANDING. We had the tasting menu which was just an incredible experience and I would highly recommend it to anyone that loves Japanese food or wants to try it for the first time. I would definitely recommend the hotel to friends and will stay there again on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FAY1357
Reviews.Content: In the past five years whenever we we went to Amsterdam we stay in this hotel for several reasons: It is very clean,it's been remodeled recently, the staff is wonderful and they have very good breakfasts. There is one issue with this hotel and that's the location. For us it's been a bonus since we are very active people and we walked every day to Dam square which is the city's main attraction, and we wanted to be away from noisy streets around the Dam. But if you want to be on Dam square then this is not for you. I also have to mention that the tram#25 takes you from Okura straight to Dam in 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service - overpriced and watch out for the food poisoning”
Reviews.Author: evoluptua
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a corporate event - its a beautiful looking hotel and a good location - however the reception staff were off hand and unfriendly - and they also wanted to take 100 euros off my credit card per evening we were booked in there - so wanted 300 euros from me which would only be refunded 5 working days after I'd checked out - which is ridiculous -especially as our booking was on account anyway. I was upgraded and my room was nice with a great view although not worth anywhere near the 570 euros it was quoted at. (though it was lovely to be upgraded!) The television remote was temperamental with only a few channels as were the light switch and air con. Nespresso machines were a nice touch but you had to constantly ask for extra sugar/milk if you wanted to use it more than once. To top it off 2 of our party got food poisoning from room service - one of them seriously. Apparently no-one else complained so they won't do anything about it. Our bill for our meal was also rounded up by an astonishing 60 euros!!!!!! which one of our unsuspecting delegates signed for in good faith - they have also failed to rectify this. The reception areas might be luxurious but having checked out a few hotels in Amsterdam this weekend -the rooms at the Park and newly opened Mint hotels are much nicer and better located and far better value for money. I should also mention that on top of 195 euros for a standard room you also pay amsterdam tax, 29.95 for breakfast (which really isn't worth it!) and an extra 15 euros if you want to use the gym - not a cheap stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Okura, great stay”
Reviews.Author: lady_jamrock
Reviews.Content: I just came back from the okura amsterdam yesterday, had a lovely stay Rooms- i had a standard room, which was nice, huge tv, mini bar and a view over looking the canal which was nice. There was some mould on the shower curtain, so didnt use the curtain at all,also in the bath was some grey dented stains, these were the only 2 problems, the freebies were topped up,the rooms kept clean, my room was a little bit old fashioned, so i think the room needs an upgrade, the lamps were quite shabby, but for the price i paid it was good. Breakfast-which was included in my package: can i firstly just say Kim, is a credit to the la camelia, so helpfu, friendly and very attentive! you should keep her! also juan was just as friendly and nice. The selection was very good, had some weird things like salad and soup, but as they have a lot of japenese guests its understandable. They had crossaints, donuts,pastries, cold meats, cheeses, diffrent breads, fruit, strawberries grapes etc, yogurts, smoothies, granola and a lot of cerals, they also do pancakes which were good, sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, tomatoes etc, muffins, it was a huge selection! They do ask you for a deposit, which is 100 euros per night of your stay, which was not mentioned when i booked, this is hotel policy, i am now having trouble getting them to take my money off hold, even though i am back in the country, they do not answer my e-mails, this is very sad as everything else in the hotel is of the highest standard. The thing i liked most was to get the lift to work you had to use your key card, which is a great idea, all in all this is a good hotel. Just get the traam from central st, number 25, when you get off at cornelis troopstein, it even says okura hotel, the area that the hotel is in, is lovely, it is a 4 min walk to the shops, the is a grocery store calld AH, you must try the thai place for food, i dont know what its called but its a dark red shop, there is also a nice bakery on the corner opposite a tram stop, the canal next door is nice and there are loads of coffee shops around. The internet is expensive 6 dollars for 1 hour or 12 dollars for the day. The pillows and linen are of a high quality and you can tell the difference.

Reviews.Title: “we had a great time, for sure will be back”
Reviews.Author: michelsaskia
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the excecutive suite, the room was spacious, well decorated, and very conveniant. The beds where very nice. The hotel staff was very polite and helpfull. There is a choise of four restaurants, so a tast for everyone. Also the breakfast was supurp. At night a visite to the coctail/ champagne bar on the 23th floor is a must. The coctails where very good and the view breath taking. Overall we had a very nice stay and will be visiting soon again. Thanks for everythiing

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Prices, 2 Star Facility, 1 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: geminigirl789
Reviews.Content: I should have realised when, on check in, I asked for a high floor and was told 'we don't have anything else at the rate you paid', that it wasn't going to be the best hotel experience. Full disclosure-the rate I paid was about GBP 300 per night, so hardly something for the front desk staff to sneer at. As a female business traveller, one thing of paramount importance to me is a proper hair dryer. The Okura, believe it or not, still has the ghastly wall mounted wand monstrosities that waft lukewarm air but still manage to burn your hands-I haven't seen one of them in at least 10 years, and NEVER in what's held out to be a 5 star property. Then there's the internet. Specifically the wireless internet, which the Okura has contracted out to Ibahn. 3 days, 7 phone calls (upwards of GBP 40 in mobile phone bills!) and numerous charges to my Amex which have yet to be credited, and I had internet access for all of 30 minutes. And this is billed as a business hotel. The room was fine, the bed was fine, the bath was fine, apart from the hair dryer. The air conditioning, unfortunately, didn't work properly, so, while some of my colleagues were complaining of being cold, my room was so hot and stuffy that it was impossible to sleep. Okura maintenance staff weren't up to the task of fixing it, and again, 'at the rate I'd paid' for the room, nothing else was available. I can't remember the last time I had such uncaring staff, and such a poor experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: chambermusiclady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a 3 day/night business event. It was a 5 star experience. The rooms were spacious and beautifully outfitted. Luxury linens and toiletries were provided. A large marble bathroom had both a shower, with two choices of shower head,s and a separate soaking tub. The service and food in every restaurant and bar was top notch. We called the front desk with a minor plumbing problem and someone was repairing the issue within 5 mins. The front desk staff and the concierge were very professional and helpful. It is a short distance outside the central area of Amsterdam but it was still walking distance to all of the major museums and sites. There is also a tram stop outside of the hotel if you are not the walking type. My only complaint was the wireless internet was unstable and my service was spotty. The technical support for the internet was a connection to a service in India which was not exactly "service". The business event may have overloaded the wireless internet capabilities.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury - Nice & Clean”
Reviews.Author: traxstar
Reviews.Content: Came there very late and went on very early next morning. I can only say, this Hotel is very nice and clean, had more than 3 restaurants. We ate on one of these, its very expensive cause of the luxury. Its 20min of walking distance to the Holland Casino and all the pubs, shopping etc. Anyway, I loved it, the room was big and we got these exclusive rooms. It was all free though, I would never pay for so much for a room, cause on vacation, you're not supposed to be in the room :D

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: nathaliebovenberg
Reviews.Content: Wondrful hotel, outstanding staffing and wonderful service. Highly reccomended for leasure and business travel. Conferencing facilities of high standard accompanied with outstanding service!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel just outside the City Center”
Reviews.Author: drkevinwong
Reviews.Content: Hotel Okura is a wonderful hotel just south of the city center. You do need to take some sort of transportation to get to the sites of the city. We had a wonderful time riding around the city on bikes...it is the most relaxing and fun way to see Amsterdam. This was our first time traveling to Europe and we were dreading the size of the rooms. At Hotel Okura, the rooms are what you would expect in a nicer US hotel like a Hyatt - nice sheets, slippers, marble or granite counters. It was a wonderful place to rest after a full day of site seeing and bike riding. We didn't try any of the restaurants because we wanted to experience Amsterdam's cuisine, but it looked exquisite and the restaurant on the top floor had an incredible view.

Reviews.Title: “Dam luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: LondonBones
Reviews.Content: We got a secret deal on lastminute and initially I was disappointed with the location, being further out of town. However in the end, we really enjoyed the neighbourhood, it had a more of a local feel and the market near by was excellent. I have stayed in the centre of town previously and this was far more relaxed and less touristy. The trams come regularly and whisk you to town pretty quickly so we didnâ€™t feel like we were missing out. The hotel itself is very luxurious, we paid half price for a suite and it was huge, with king size bed and a bathroom almost as big as my London flat. The views were also great! My only grip was that our climate control wasn't working so our room was very warm when trying to sleep. Breakfast was free as part of our deal and while it was nice I wouldnâ€™t have wanted to pay the â‚¬30 charge. Itâ€™s also easy and quick to get to/from the airport by taxi/shuttle or even catching the train, which we did on the way back; the RAI station only a 15 minute walk. All in all, a good standard hotel and deserving of its 5 star rating, with very attentive service. Like most of these type of hotels, paying full whack on the personal account is perhaps a step to far but if you can get a good deal it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all aspects!”
Reviews.Author: Belly2007
Reviews.Content: First off: You must eat at the very very excellent Ciel Bleu restaurant! For a michelin starred restaurant, it was value for money and the service was great, no snobbishness at all! The Japanese teppanyaki place Sazanka was also soo good!!! However, I found this to be a bit pricey as I ate by myself and ran up a Eur120 bill. Pros: - Good buffet breakfast selection! Scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, softboiled eggs, assorted pastries, miso soup, beans, bacon, etc.... - Nespresso machine in each room ensuring great coffee each time! - Comfy, large bed - Spacious toilet with Tub, shower ad 'his' and 'hers' sinks - Worktable with several electrical outlets - important when you're charging 2 laptops, 2 cellphones, 1 camera - Closet for clothes and area for luggage storage - Very very nice and helpful staff!! Con: The only con is that this hotel is not located in the center or old town, but I actually managed to walk from the old town, to the Van Gogh Museum, past the parks, and back at our hotel, in about 45 minutes. The weather was nice and lots to see along the way! Also, room service food isn't very good. While my husband was at meetings, I ordered room service and found some soups too salty, some salads too sour... but their restaurants are good. I guess a different kitchen prepares room service food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michi042
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Okura Hotel 2 weeks ago and our stay was simple fantastic. The staff is very helpful, the rooms are spotless and overall the hotel is just excellent. It is located in a quiet neighborhood but short distance from the action by taking Tram 25. In the area there are nice cafes and restaurant. Our overall stay was fantastic and I would come back to this hotel without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: reissu-erkki01
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some pros & cons. + Very clean, good location with good access to city centre. Good beds and sleep quality. Friendly service. - Quite expensive in general and astronomical price for breakfast. Small rooms and very low bathroom roofs, a tall person will have problems to stand straight in the shower. Toilet articles only for one person in double room. No hair conditioner either. Some confusion of the price and payment at reception. No free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good....but there are negatives”
Reviews.Author: clockwork
Reviews.Content: This is a large, modern hotel situated south of the city centre. It's mainly a residential area. Overall I liked the location but it was maybe a little too far from the action. The neighbourhood of De Pijp is in walking distance to the north (only about 10 minutes). Here you can find a few shops, some nice cafes, bars and restaurants. If you want to go the livelier places (e.g. any of the following squares - Rembrants/Leidse/Dam) then you will need to take a short tram ride. The hotel was spotless, decent bathrooms and the staff were very helpful - I cannot fault their efforts at all. The things that annoyed me were the price of the extras. There is no free WIFI....instead it is charged at a ridiculous rate. The same goes for most other extras in the hotel. For this reason alone I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at a "different" hotel”
Reviews.Author: CathyBK_77
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice location, near shops, pubs and restaurants. And only 15 min drive from Schipol Airport. Nice and professional staff. Really good breakfast, a very nice bar on 23th floor with an fantastic view, and an amazing Teppanyaki-restaurant on 1th floor. Beautiful rooms with very nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: leigh1000
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to visit Amsterdam in style this is your hotel. Tram 25 takes you right into the centre just outside the hotel. The area has some nice restaurants very close and also the ones in the hotel. Walking distance to the market.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive- Nice Hotel but has its faults”
Reviews.Author: galcan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Easter Weekend. I liked the location. A nice tram ride from town and away from all the city centre madness. Felt on booking it that it was pricey but went with it. Didnt seem to be much atmosphere about the hotel so didnt stay long. The room was clean though and nice view. On the down side I was annoyed to have to pay â‚¬6 for a small bottle of natural water from the room fridge. That was just extorionate. Also , when we requested a change of pillow they said that they had no other pillows. For a high star hotel, i found that hard to believe. We ended up using the pillows off the hotel room armchairs to sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: HappyTummyHouston
Reviews.Content: The Okura is a first class hotel in all ways. It is probably the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. View of the city from the top floor bar is super.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and culinary experience”
Reviews.Author: ChampBouwman
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic night over in the OKURA Amsterdam hotel. One of the great hotels of Holland. A perfect room, perfect service combined with a unique culinary experience in restaurant Ciel Blue made it an unforgettable night. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “One word: excellent”
Reviews.Author: Halfar
Reviews.Content: Okura was an experience. Beautiful and service as you can expect.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but OK”
Reviews.Author: Lynnburn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Okura for 2 nights while attending a conference at RAI. The hotel is in a very quiet area on a canal with Japanese Gardens around it. I had the same problem with this hotel as I have with virtually every '5 star' hotel - it was impersonal, and made even more expensive by being charged exorbitantly for every little extra. Hotels should take a leaf out of the airline, and indeed Stena Line ferry book - once you pay your room fee everything else should be included. I would always choose such a hotel (do any exist???) even if the initial cost was more. Otherwise the room had a great view, the room service was fine and the food was fine. The only down side was discovering black mould on the shower curtain just as I wad about to check out.

Reviews.Title: “â€œAwful, definitely not value for moneyâ€�”
Reviews.Author: politeman
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel. I don't think this can be a 5 star hotel. The horrible and annoying thing ? I had a prepaid tariff. I went out for lunch and 1 hour later I have received a message from my bank informing that the hotel was keeping 100 euros as guarantee. They didn't inform me in advance. It was unpolite and unprofessional. The staff is terrible. They could give me any explanation.

Reviews.Title: “Smart but Overated”
Reviews.Author: jamiewade
Reviews.Content: The price was about right for the room, it was very large and deluxe as described. The staff are polite and professional, but room service left a lot to be desired. Ate at the ground floor restaurant, it was fine but nothing to write home about. Only negative was location, quite a distance out, tram stop outside, took about twenty mins to centre. Would stay again if someone else was paying.

Reviews.Title: “Good but pricey”
Reviews.Author: corty13
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Amsterdam with my 12 year old daughter in July 2010.The hotel is very nice and our room was very spacious. I think charging extra for internet service was a bit much considering the price of the room. The hotel is not close to much, but it is close to the bus/tram/metro lines. The hotel itself is very clean, but the bar had an awful musty smell. The breakfast buffet was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marian_0092
Reviews.Content: We visited Hotel Okura Amsterdam in the beginning of January and really enjoyed our stay in this luxurious hotel! We had booked a deluxe room and received a free upgrade to an executive room with a magnificent view over Amsterdam. We were surprised by the free Nespresso coffee in the rooms, the opportunity to watch a movie while enjoying a bath and the great service / special treatment we received during our stay. The extensive breakfast buffet in the morning was everything we expected from a 5 star Hotel and was of good quality. The shops and the Albert Cuypmarket were in walking distance and the tram which stopped in front of the hotel brought us directly to the Dam square. We had a wonderful time in Amsterdam and in the Okura and look forward staying there again soon! Marian & Ton Breda, The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: alexthomas
Reviews.Content: We found that charging extra for room service, internet and the gym greatly added to the cost of our stay. food and drinks are expensive. Found main japaneese restauarant diappointing

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for city trip”
Reviews.Author: marian011
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel on a perfect location: the Okura Amsterdam. A great room with a beautiful view over Amsterdam city, very friendly and helpfull staff making your stay even more relaxed, and within walking distance of a typical Amsterdam area. Public transport to city centre, musea just a minute away. However for dinner you better stay in the hotel, what an great culinary experience, I wish we could stay longer. Next year for sure!

Reviews.Title: “PLUSH AND AMAZING TEPANYAKI”
Reviews.Author: zeeshm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably one of the best in Amsterdam. We were here on a business trip and I am sure our temp PA made a mistake by booking us in here, but it was the best mistake she made. We ate at the amazing Tepanyaki restaurant which was picked up by the company and I was throughly pleased with that result. My colleague born and bred in Essex even liked the food, and his staple diet is "steak and chips" or "burger and chips". Staff are welcoming but probably because they are getting paid well. Location is further out from town - so not a place to stay if your after touristy hotspots. FInally and thankfully - unlike the holiday inn - you dont have to worry about a bloody bike running you over, the bike lanes seem far away here.

Reviews.Title: “japanese-european hybrid at its best”
Reviews.Author: jointadventures
Reviews.Content: I stayed a lot in the Okura in Tokyo, which was constructed by the father of the famous architect Taniguchi Yoshio (MomA New York) and I had not expected that the genes would travel. Yet they do, the place is sophistacted and refined, the staff doing everything you need in a sublime manner. We were invited to a huge dinner in honor of the president of the prince claus foundation, and were inspired by the blend of Asian-European delicacies. Perfectly timed, unusually arranged sashimi, and seafood salads were served on beds of salad of real leafs and algea. The location is not central, it will take you 15 minutes to get to the center however.

Reviews.Title: “Read Me”
Reviews.Author: russy177
Reviews.Content: The bad reviews i guess are about the standard rooms , go 4 the executive floors 17th to 20th. The rooms the are much better, have been in Marriott, Renaisance, Krasnoplsky ( now that is a dump 4 sure) , Okura is 100 percent the best luxury hotel in AMS (Leading Hotels) , Yamazato, Ciel blu ,the best restaurants ( 4 luxury) located in hotel. BUT the location is really POOR. So if its not your time in AMS and you just wanna relax and have a quet time Okura is fine. Bring Lots of money , Breakfat si 40 euro pp, Lunch at Yamazato is about 80 euro pp, Dinner at Ciel Blue 100 - 150 euro pp without alcohol. Also the are many suites at the hotel category above executive , from 800 to 10 000 euro per night, i recommend go for one around 1500 euro per night for a luxury stay. Over all Okura is the BEST hotel in AMS in the WORST possible location. THIS IS 1 000 000 PERCENT REAL INFO. NO NEED TO READ ANY OTHER REWIEWS 1 000 000 PERCENT GUARANTEE.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value”
Reviews.Author: falcon3760
