Reviews.Content: The good points of this hotel are the excellent staff and the quality of the furnishings and amenities in the rooms. But, by its pricing, this hotel is competing at a high level and I felt it fell short in this regard, more 4* standard and it's pricing policy gave the impression of owners/managers looking for every opportunity to fleece their guests. The bad points included - a very compact room which at 250 euros plus tax, was not worth the money - a ludicrously expensive breakfast at 30 euros, which could not even claim to show any imagination and included the dreaded sweaty 'buffet bacon'. At this price, I expect flair and/or breakfast to be freshly cooked and plated. The in room breakfast was even worse, comprising hard toast, unpleasant pastries and a boiled egg that was hard boiled. Since the hotel does have high quality (though again, seriously expensive) restaurants, there really is no excuse for this standard - when I complained, I was offered the alternative 'light breakfast' of a coffee and 2 croissants, for an inflated 15.5 euros, but note they are really aiming to catch you for the higher rate - an equally ludicrous 17 euros a day for internet access - a quite unacceptable 15 euros to use the hotel swimming pool, a quite unheard of practise for a core facility, and more akin to the likes of Ryanair's approach - the main downstairs bar seemed to shut at 10pm - aircon in the room did not seem to go below 20 degrees, for those who prefer cooler temperatures when they sleep - to cap it all, I could have got the room 20% cheaper on the internet compared to the conference rate, obviously viewing conference business as a valid cause for more fleecing If you stayed as a couple, had the breakfast, used the pool and the internet, your actual rate would around 370 euros. Message to the management. Your customers notice these practises, won't ever return and will write reviews like this.

Reviews.Title: “Better value for money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Travellerwithoutname
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel with 5 star prices but without the service/delivery you should expect. You can get better value for money elsewhere. A few issues: 1. Rooms not ready for check in until 1800 - "you can change in the health club sir" 2. rooms only cleaned around 1700 - working in a dirty hotel room most of the day. 3. No complimentary newspaper. 4. Airco broken - had to call maintenance. 5. Master light switch broken - had to call maintenance. 6. Health club - pay extra! 7. Internet - pay 17 euros a day extra! 8. Coffee in room limited to 3 capsules for the machine (value 90 cents). I could go on but really, at these prices you should expect a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: arevan_1
Reviews.Content: A very cosy and comfortable hotel. Service is truly excellent, staff is very professional and helpful. Breakfast is fresh and varied, we also tried one of the Japanese restaurants which was great! The bar on the 23rd floor offers great views (as expected) and good cocktails. As for the rooms, get one of the recently renovated superior or deluxe rooms, there really is a huge difference between those and the standard rooms. The latter felt old and were much less stylish, still very comfy and spotless clean however. As mentioned by others, you have to pay extra for everything on this hotel. The health club is well worth its price but Internet access is too expensive IMO (6 euro/hour). The hotel is situated in what felt like a mostly residential neighbourhood just outside the city centre. To us the location is an advantage - away from the tourist hordes and souvenir shops, but still all the main sightseeing spots are a pleasant walk or a short tram ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Ninja Like Okura”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_O_Really
Reviews.Content: Pricelined this for a decent rate and was pleasantly surpised by the quality of the room and hotel. We did not utilize any other faclities in the hotel although they did look quite nice. Room was CLEAN! Bed was comfy. Water pressure in the shower was decent although the tub was elevated which made for a bit of a hassle getting in or out. Hotel is out a bit out from the noise of the city center but that worked best for us. Tram line within a five minute walk that we became well acquainted with. Took a cab one night from the city center and it ran us around 15 euro. Clientele looked a bit on the wealthy side. Security is tight there at night to keep out the evil Ninjas. Front desk people were great. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: PatrickSH
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here. Very stylish - the Japanese influence being clear to see. Visited the excellent teppanyaki restaurant and the bar on the 23rd floor. Both very enjoyable, in particular the restaurant. Was upgraded on arrival and found the room to be very comfortable. The staff were all very helpful. Would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but services are too expensive”
Reviews.Author: DrBot51
Reviews.Content: The interior of the hotel is quite nice and welcoming. The staff were very friendly for the most part and made sure everything was smooth for me. The room was average but I admit, I did expect abit more for a 5-star hotel. Their services are ridiculously expensive. To make a call to the US cost 2.70 euros a minute and to a Netherlands cell phone I was charged 3.70 euros connection fee. I was also charged 3.75 euros connection fee for a toll free number which I was pretty upset about. About four days into my stay the sink faucet broke but was promptly fixed. I commend Okura for that. Overall I will recommend this hotel to a friend but I'll advice them to eat outside as their menu is really expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: KateHarsh
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded for free to a Jr. Deluxe Suite and when the person bringing our bags up found out it was our honeymoon, room service came up with complimentary Chardonnay and chocolates with a card wishing us a lifetime of love and happiness!

Reviews.Title: “Faded grandeur”
Reviews.Author: pernideor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Okura on a business trip in August. For something which is supposedly a member of "The Leading Hotels of the World" I found it very disappointing. I arrived at the hotel by own car. Normally in five star hotels they have Valet parking but here a surly front man pointed me to a dimly lit underground parking garage. Check in was fine although I was SHOCKED when I asked about the fitness center. Yes - they had one but it was an additional â‚¬15 to use. INCREDIBLE. I was already paying more than â‚¬ 200 for the room. I have never seen this before. The room itself looked like something that might have once upon a time been considered "grand" but the furniture was faded, fixtures old fashioned and the air conditioning did not work properly. Finally in the morning the extremely expensive buffet breakfast was the poorest selection I have ever seen in a five star hotel. I left quickly and I don't think I will be coming back. Nothing majorly wrong if you were paying â‚¬ 80 and this advertised itself as a medium hotel. However luxury it IS NOT!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: rinsketenhoopen
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in a beautiful room with a beautiful view. The service was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: MarcelSchlaman
Reviews.Content: We had (again) an excellent stay at the Okura hotel last weekend. The Executive junior suite is a nice spacious suite with dramatic views over Amsterdam. The Okura is the only hotel in Amsterdam that can offer these views. The refurbishments off the rooms, lobby and restaurants over the past years have been extensive and led to great improvement. Look forward to the opening of the new hotel bar is August and the repositioning of the breakfast room to the serre. With the variety of restaurants (of witch two Michelin star restaurants) and a sky bar the hotel has great F&B facilities. The health club, with sauna, gym and large swimming pool is very relaxing. Which brings me on the only down side, there is no possibility to relax outside the health club although you can see the beautiful Japanese garden through the windows. Marcel Schlaman.

Reviews.Title: “Nice chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jugra74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our way from Mexico to South Africa for the Soccer World Cup. Good location and nice designed rooms with japanese touches. Amazing views. Very good variety of restaurants but expensice. Service was personal and friendly. Greeted with name every day. Unusual in a big hotel .Good business facilities. One of my friends forgot travel documents in Mexico and the staff organised it that he received it before we left. Nicely done. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but wouldn't choose it again”
Reviews.Author: philsdottir
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week for a meeting in June 2010. I chose to stay here for the convenience because the hotel was the location of the conference. Lobby/Reception: I found the lobby rather nice for meeting people in, there are a number of sofas and chairs that can be used for small meetings or waiting for colleagues. It was clean, open, brightly lit, it is very stark and sparse in style. The front desk staff was very nice and competent - no problems there and they let us check out the night before we left so we could go straight to the airport. Unlike another reviewer, I was happy with the concierge. We put him into service a number of times, from directions to the Pijp market area to restaurant suggestions to shopping suggestions. The elevators were enough to accommodate everyone, I never waited inordinately long for one. Rooms: My room was very nice, with a great view of the canal, the stadium, etc. I loved how I could put the shade up between the bathroom and the rest of the room, and see the outdoors, the TV, etc. from the bath. The shower is nice - has the handheld and the rainshower parts both. The TV is a flat screen, best viewed from the chair near the window. Lots of channels in a number of different languages. There was a safe that worked well, big closets, and a minibar fridge that didn't have sensors so you could put your own food into it. (Although considering a block up the street was the Savoy that had free minibar items and free coffee, tea and continental breakfast...) It was annoying that there wasn't even a hot pot with tea bags or coffee maker in the room. Comfortable pillows and duvet. However, you cannot change the thermostat, which was annoying. I arrived during a cold spell, and didn't have clothing as warm as I needed for sleeping and being in the room - I tried to change the temperature, but it was stuck at 20 degrees C. I thought it was my room but my colleagues had the same complaint! What's the use of having individual thermostats in your rooms if the guests can't make use of them? Location: At first I wasn't thrilled with this location. It is outside of the downtown area. But as I spent more time in the Pijp I liked it more. There are a couple of tram lines that are right there - five minutes outside the hotel to both the right and the left there are tram stops = and the lines take you to the downtown areas. Get the map from the front desk or concierge. Also, it is very near to the Albert something or other market, which is really nice and has a LOT of bars and restaurants all over the place. It's also near a delightful park where tons of people hang out and is really pleasant. There are a number of great restaurants within 2 blocks, including some steakhouses, the best Caprese salad I have ever had, lots of Japanese restaurants that I didn't try, and a great local breakfast and coffee place called "@7". There are three grocery stores within three blocks as well. Restaurants: Actually, I wouldn't know. They were so expensive there's no way I could eat there. (The concierge responded appropriately and didn't seem to judge when we asked for recommendations of casual, inexpensive places.) Breakfast alone would have been 30 euros. Some colleagues were caught between meetings and got sandwiches in the bar - they were like cold cut sandwiches on wheat bread - and we got the ,2L of coke to sip while accompanying them - their sandwiches were 25 euros and our sodas almost 5 euros. Insane! Luckily there are some great restaurants nearby. Extras: This was my biggest issue. EVERYTHING was an extra. Want to use the gym? That'll be 15 euros. Want internet? 17 euros. I sucked it up and did the gym twice, but only when I made sure I had enough time to use EVERYTHING and take full advantage of it. No 15 euros to hop on the treadmill or stairmaster for half an hour and done. No, I took full advantage of the 18 meter pool to swim 2km each time (it is a very nice pool, but they don't use lanelines and it got choppy to try and swim with 3 people in the pool - don't know what would have happened if there had been a fourth), I also used the sauna, the jacuzzi, the tanning booth in the ladies locker room, even the showers and their own conditioner, shampoo and body wash. BTW, the pool was cold and jacuzzi not all that warm either - it was fine for me but it wasn't normal. The locker setup was nice, you could have a locker with a key, which you could fasten around a wrist and ankle while you swam or worked out, so you could have hands free and not worry about it. There were some machines and a couple of free weights but not a whole lot there. I went elsewhere for internet. At this caliber of hotel I would expect these items to be included, as well as at least a continental breakfast. All in all, it turned out fine, but I would not stay here again. For the money - and also on principle - there are places just as good where you get a lot more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive, snotty concierge”
Reviews.Author: zetaarae
Reviews.Content: I will say that the room, a basic room, was spacious and full of light, with two big windows, which we enjoyed. Overall, though, for the exorbitant price, it was not that impressive at all. On the outside of town, and nothing about it really stood out, other than the bar at the top floor, which did have an amazing view of the city. You know what, though, I am sure the restaurants were great -- but the prices were just insane. I could not bring myself to pay 29.50 Euros (equivalent to nearly $40 US) per person for breakfast. It's just a bread basket, hard boiled egg, fruit, and coffee/juice. WTF? We peeped at the dinner menu for one of the restaurants, and it was even crazier. I had read that the restaurants were pricey, but really had no idea just how expensive...at five star restaurants in Dallas, I have spent as much as $125 for a special event and an exquisite meal for two people. That seems like a lot, but I was OK with it, for the experience. However, this pricing was absolutely crazy town, in my opinion. I saw another reviewer mentioning spending over 200 Euros for dinner! Would you pay $260 U.S. dollars for food? Just doesn't make sense to me. It will be gone in less than an hour. One day, we went down to meet with the concierge to ask about a beach that a friendly bartender had recommended to us. We could not remember the name, but it sounded great, so I thought the concierge might know. We smiled, said hello, and explained what we were looking for to a desk attendant, who looked at us like we were crazy, then went to get the concierge, and translated our question to him (We spoke in English). He did not acknowledge us at all at first -- did not say a word, or even make eye contact with us. In fact, he did not glance in our direction. I felt like a slug. With a frowning face, he looked up something on his computer, then finally spoke, still not glancing at us. He asked, "Is this it?" and turned the laptop toward us. There were photos, but nothing that looked like a beach. I was embarrassed and disappointed, and felt stupid for asking in the first place. I said, "Sure, thanks." and we left. Why was he so hateful to us? I thought a concierge was supposed to be friendly and informative and welcoming. He was precisely the opposite. Was it because we spoke English? We were polite as we could be, and I would think that a hotel, which accommodates tourists by the nature of its business, should be open to people who speak other languages... I know in the U.S., this is the case, especially with Spanish and other commonly spoken languages... This was my biggest disappointment with the hotel. If I could rate the concierge, I would give him a negative five stars for making me feel like a jerk. Also, I think it sucks you have to pay extra for the Internet and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Suz60
Reviews.Content: We booked via hotels.com for a twin/queen room at around Â£147. We weren't expecting very much, really, so when we got there and checked into our room we were delighted! Our room was actually more like a mini-suite with two very comfy beds pushed together - both bigger than singles - and a just gorgeous lay out. We noticed in the wardrobe that our room usually went for 525 euros a night (double-occupancy) (not what we paid!) but at no point had we been told we were getting a fantastic deal or that we were being upgraded. The en suite bathroom had a lovely glass wall with electronic blind alongside the bed.. which was obviously very fun, but not tacky as some might fear. The desk would have been lovely to work from if we'd needed to... The room was very big, with big windows looking out. I can't praise it enough. If we're ever offered a good deal to stay there again, we will. We didn't check out the pool area etc, so hopefully we will next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: hungrymaiden
Reviews.Content: The hotel and service was ok, no real complaints we just felt a little disappointed that it wasn't better. It is not the cheapest hotel and we don't mind paying that bit extra but when you pay extra you expect to get brilliant service and amazing food not just nice service and nice food. We booked a two night stay at â‚¬265 per night but were told when we arrived it would cost and extra â‚¬30 per day to use the gym, â‚¬60 per day to include breakfast and â‚¬17 per day to use WIFI in our room so the bill soon mounts up. A drink in the bar will set you back at least â‚¬11 a drink. The cocktail bar, apparently voted the best cocktail bar in Amsterdam had a smaller selection of cocktails than expected and the standard of cocktail was not very consistent, a good cocktail was dependent of the barman that happened to serve you. We ate at the Japanese restaurant one evening and had a nice meal and the service was ok but for â‚¬220 for a meal and two drinks each we not wowed. If you are coming to Amsterdam to check out the city I would certainly recommend staying a little closer to the centre as public transport is not always running if there is an event on in the city which can make getting around a little tricky.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel near the RAI Exhibition Hall”
Reviews.Author: cernaya_mamba
Reviews.Content: We chose the Okura hotel, because it's located near the big exhibition hall - RAI and it's 5-8 minutes by walking there. The hotel has an outstanding 24/7 service and pretty good rooms. It's about 5-10 minutes by taxi and you are in the center of Amsterdam. Prices are expensive in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: fasttravellers
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on ebookers( normaly we dont stay on this type of hotel), and stayed in a deluxe dobbel room on the 21 floor. And what a room it was !! Every time we came in to the room, the curtains went up, and a beautiful view over Amsterdam revealed itself. The room was very nice, with a huge bed and flat screen tv in both bedroom and bathroom. The toilet seat was heated, and you didnt even have to wipe your own [--] :) In the evening the chamber maids made the room for the evening - pulled the covers aside, and sat the slippers beside the bed for you. Curtains and light could be regulated from the bed, by a remote. The room has everything you desire, and more. One night we came in a bit late, the portier obviously didnt think we looked like okura guests, and made funny remarks, and we had to show him our room key to convince him that we were guests at this hotel. But its ok, it says something about the class of the hotell. The hotell is located a bit far from city center. No breakfast included - boyfriend missed bacon&eggs :) The hotel had a room service, night menu, and when we called to order from it, they didnt have anything on it. Strange.... But all of the food we ordered from roomservice, was presented on a very stylish way.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay Just Outside City Centre”
Reviews.Author: glasgow77
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights over Easter. From the outside the hotel doesn't look like what I'd usually go for (modern high rise block) but inside was well designed and our room which was actually one of the unrenovated rooms was lovely. Breakfast served till midday which is perfect if you want a long lie. Ate in the Japanese restaurant one night and the food was amazing although the atmosphere and service maybe not quite what would have expected from a michelin starred restaurant (no help/explanation of dishes or advice on drinks to go with food, left to pour own wine) although the food did make up for it. Had cocktails in the bar on the 23rd floor which were lovely and the views were stunning. Location not in the centre but tram stop outside the front door means that shouldn't put you off. Really enjoyed stay there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel away from the chaos”
Reviews.Author: NYer_in_London
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel by every standard. Be warned that it is not in the city center of Amsterdam. But, It is a very easy tram trip (the hotel can even sell you the strippenkart for the tram ride). It is also a bit of a hike from the train station. If you fly in, you are better off taking a cab. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. I look forward to staying at more Okura hotels in my future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Olivier_41
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with good service. The room was very nice with all the amenities needed. Breakfast was excellent. Location may not be in the very city centre, but that should not stop you from staying in the hotel. Internet is expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Netherlands
Reviews.Content: We stay here quite offen if we wanted to be in Amsterdam. Great hotel service , food , rooms real 5 star. Especially the 2 japanese rstaurants but be sure to make a reservation. Hotels is very close to the city center. Great stay again !!

Reviews.Title: “lovely romantic stay for the two of us”
Reviews.Author: Winkelhorst
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull stay special day fot the two of us go to the museum, tour on the canals

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Scooby123Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: A perfect stay in a beautiful hotel in the middle of amsterdam where you can eat in fine restaurants and drink something in a cocktail bar on the 23 etage looking over the city. The rooms are comfortable and very beautiful...you can't compare them to other hotels

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vsteele85
Reviews.Content: Great location...beautiful ..nice rooms..great views..nice workers.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel if I could Id only stay there!”
Reviews.Author: LOLANetherlands
Reviews.Content: Went with my partner in 07 for our aniversary. The place doesnt look that special from the outside, i looks like a hotel in the 80s which hasnt been renovated! It is far from the truth.From the moment you enter you feel pampered. The staff at front desk is uber polite and professionnal,door man, bagage porter...The bathtubs are huge as well as the beds. I have to say my partner was a bit disappointed at the size of the room as he expected it to be bigger but I wasnt bothered. The breakfast is fantastic ,varied and hot and both japanese restaurants are amazing. It is a bit away from the very city center but if you re not in the mood for crazy partying in the red light district, then this area is definitely for you. I recommend it for couples as it has a very romantic atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: La_Viaggiatrice075
Reviews.Content: I offered to my husband a weekend at the Okura for his birthday, we had already a positive Okura experience in Japon and wanted to test the Okura in Amsterdam. Well, I must say the true, Okura was wonderful, relaxing with excellent service. As I had informed them of my husband's birthday we had been upgraded from deluxe to executive room, with delicatessen and sparkling wine in room and each member of the staff we met during the stay had congratulated my husband for his birthday. The room was big, with all electronic gadgets (from curtain opening to other details...), the bathroom was great too with bathtube and separate shower and the toilet had the TOTO system. We had dinner at the Yamazoto restaurant food was excellent , the best japanese food we had (outside Japan), we had also a drink at the bar on the top floor very nice te view and the service was great. We used the heath center, good gym and wonderful spa; if you have to stay at the Okura don't miss it. This is the perfect hotel for a relaxing week-end or a pleasant business trip. We will definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place for a perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: ferryHoorn
Reviews.Content: In a weekend in oktober we went to visit Okura hotel in Amsterdam during a city trip. A great place with terrific rooms, nice view of amsterdam and a perfect service. We enjoyed the cocktails in the upper bar under the star roof while looking over amsterdam by night. The breakfast has different choices for everyone and everything was so nice we didn't know wat to eat so we ate way to much ;-). The staff is really nice and helpfull. Next time in amsterdam we will definitely stay in the Okura hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility - superb service - esp. 23d bar and Coffee facility grounf floor”
Reviews.Author: CleanSafe
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our family in 3 rooms to celebrate our 35th Wedding anniversary, which started with our Honeymoon night in the same Okura. The hotel has changed a lot in the mean time, it was good it is superb now. The rooms are outstanding, so is the service. We especially enjoyed an 'evening out' at the 23d bar - fine drinks and great service - worth every penny. We will be back - Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel- nice stay”
Reviews.Author: lem0n7
Reviews.Content: I liked my stay at the Okura, we got un upgrate to a renovated room very nice. Very good ,young,nice staff at the reception to get the tickets to the van gogh museum, to get a taxi , a reservation at the japonees restaurant that was fully booked, the valet parking. I felt very relaxed at the okura without worry. Nice bar on the top of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Overvalued”
Reviews.Author: TxKjngrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for a convention my husband was attending. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful so there were no complaints in that area. Our room was a corner room and was quite spacious. However, it looked a little worn and needed some updating. The bathroom was small and the water pressure from the shower was not good and there was mold along the bottom of the shower curtain. The room and bathroom were clean other than the moldy shower curtain. I would not recommend this hotel and feel there are better choices for the money in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The Okura Amsterdam Hotel is a fantastic hotel which is a little off the beaten path, but still has good access!”
Reviews.Author: JAYDenver
Reviews.Content: The Okura is a first rate hotel. It is a little off the beaten path which adds to it's charm! It still has good access to the city center via tram. Good restaurants are located nearby, and are a little less touristy! The hotel is modern and immaculate, staff is first rate, restaurants are also top notch! Japanese breakfast is a nice alternative to the usual breakfast fare (must make reservation). Will stay here again on future trips to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Strictly an Expense Account Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travels46
Reviews.Content: The Okura, given it's proximity to the RAI (Amsterdam's impressive trade show/conference center), is priced for those that are spending someone elses money. If you drive to Amsterdam expect to pay about 35 Euros a day to park in the hotel lot. Breakfast is very expensive and lacking. Walk out the hotel front and turn left. There is a very gÆ¡d breakfast restaurant two blocks away on the right. The rÆ¡ms were modern, large and well kept. Having said that, I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchmannl
Reviews.Content: At arrival at the Okura everything looks great, like a 5 star hotel. No worries, all required extra's for a 5 star hotel are in there. My corner room was spacious, but dated. So far all fine. But the staff really forgot that they work in a 5 star hotel. Examples: - At check in my room was not ready. Not a problem: I was early. I checked in and they promised me that my luggage would be at my room when my room was ready. Later I picked up my key and verified if my luggage would be there. "yes it is there". Guess what: It was not when i got in my room. - I had to wait for 15 minutes to get an elevator. I spoke with the staff about this: They simply don't react to this. No excuses, no reason or whatever. - At departure I left my luggage at the concierge. Later I picked it up again and gave my voucher to the concierge. He invited me to walk with him into to storage and pick my suitcase out of there These are not big things, but absolutely not things that you expect in a 5 star hotel, which also is part of the "leading hotels of the world" brand. Outside the staff issues is the hotel charging you ridiculous amounts for everything: - Breakfast 29 Euro. Better walk 5 minutes. Leave the hotel area to the left. on the right hand sight you find a small Breakfast restaurant called @7 (Scheldestraat 92). - Internet, depending on speed, 29 Euro - Gym, 15 Euro "the leading hotels of the world" brand has a better hotel in centre Amsterdam: Hotel L'Europe, which has this real 5 star feeling, or just stay in a decent 4 star hotel like Park Plaza Victoria: cheaper and the same quality

Reviews.Title: “Okura- pretty good place to say”
Reviews.Author: vjhandley
Reviews.Content: Okura is a 5 star hotel and the service definitely was. The rooms were pretty good, good size and had everything you needed. The location is ok - Okura is not in the centre of town it is a little way out. When we visited the trams were not working one night and were a long wait the other night which was a bit of a pain. The food in Okura is over priced but what you expect from a hotel which has micilen stars. Good place to stay if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Victoria711
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Okura in Amsterdam in May of 2009. I arrived at the hotel early and so couldn't check in, but the staff were more than helpful and offered to take our luggage so that we could go and explore the city before returning later in the afternoon. On returning, we had been upgraded to a corner room. This was on the 15th floor and had great views over the canals and the local area. The room itself was very spacious and had twin beds, with more than enough room to live comfortable for the three days we stayed there. The room also had a large mirrored wardrobe, and plenty of cupboard space for everything. The bathroom was also spacious and had everything you need, including a hairdryer and toiletries. The first night I stayed there, I visited the 23rd Bar which is located on the 23rd floor of the hotel. It is apparently one of the most chic bars in the city, but I found it to be rather uncomfortable. It had panoramic views over the city, but everyone there were in couples and they were getting VERY cosy, so it made me wonder just what exactly is the "in" thing to do in that bar. Breakfast at the hotel was satisfactory, although not the best, certainly not the worst either. It featured everything from continental foods to the traditional full English. If you haven't got it included in the room, I wouldn't recommend paying extra for it. I found the best thing about this hotel was it's easy transport links to the centre. The tram stop is a very short walk from the hotel and for about 2 Euros, you could get the tram right into the main Dam square. We had no problems using this service, and it was very handy whilst we were there. Taxis can be very expensive, so avoid them at all costs. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a luxury base to see Amsterdam. Comfortable rooms and a pleasant location make for a very pleasing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the "Standard Room" when booking online!”
Reviews.Author: JenChi
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night trip to Amsterdam through expedia and were very excited to see a 5 star hotel come up for Â£265pp. This worked out at roughly Â£120 per night for the hotel which seemed like a great bargain for a 5 star hotel. However were really disapointed when we arrived to be assigned a very shabby and retro looking hotel room which in some areas was quite grubby. When we complained we were told that the hotel was being renovated and only 50% had been completed, we were on a floor of rooms which hadn't been renovated, hence the price. This wasn't made clear when booking and as we were expecting 5* luxary (regardless of price) we were suprised at the standard of the room. We were particularly shocked to discover that the normal price of the room we stayed in had we not booked online was over 400 Euro's which would have been ridiculously high. On a positive note, the hotel did move us to another room, not a renovated one but a junior suite which was still on the unrenovated retro side, as it was so large it felt like adequate compensation. The rest of the hotel is lovely with a nice terrace bar overlooking the canal and a cool cocktail bar on the top floor. One last piece of advice, dont order room service for breakfast, its overpriced and not very good. The hotel is also a good 20 mins on the tram from the centre of town so if you're looking to be in the centre of things its not ideal. Its is walking distance (or 10 mins on tram) from the museum quarter though which was ideal for us.

Reviews.Title: “ok but rooms old fashioned, location not ideal”
Reviews.Author: Bunwin
Reviews.Content: Booked late deal via expedia expecting a great 5 star hotel - though it has the facilities of a 5* and the recently refurbished lobby/bar(s) are very attractive the standard room we booked was not only shabby and outdated but was not cleaned to the standard I would expect of a 5* hotel (dirty windows etc). We complained and were advised that the hotel was in the process of being refurbished and we had not paid the full rate (thankfully!) despite this our concerns were addressed and we were moved to a junior suite (same issues but marginally nicer!) Overall rooms that have not been refurbished are more like 3* and location is a little removed thus taxis and trams are essential if you wish to visit the centre. Food is expensive - we had room service breakfast as were unprepared to pay 29 euros for a buffet breakfast but even at 6 euros the breakfast (scrambled eggs and sausage) was cold and rather revolting!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tooth-fixer67
Reviews.Content: Went on a Holland America cruise and spent fly over night here. Wow! I'm used to staying at 2 and 3 star hotels with Rick Steves tours, this was something special. Great view from a large room. Very nice breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel but Overpriced and Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: colt123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 3 week Northern European Cruise with Holland America. We flew into Amsterdam and spent one night at the Okura before starting the cruise. Since the night was part of a "package" we didn't pay for the hotel directly, but I checked out what it would have cost us if we'd reserved on our own, and it wasn't worth the price, particularly when the hotel is located in the southern part of the city, a long distance from the main part of town in the north, and far from any major sites. Unless you love to walk, you'll end up taking public transportation or a taxi (there were many lined up at the entrance and several were Mercedes!). The were no restaurants close by, other than the HIGHLY priced ones located at the hotel (meals started at 70 Euros!). We walked around that afternoon looking for restaurants and finally found some, but they were all closed due to late July being "holiday" time. We searched for an ATM to pick up Euros but there were none at the hotel or in the direct vicinity. We ended up finding some food at a small deli several blocks away from the hotel and eating in our room. Most of the Okura clients appeared to be Japanese businessmen in expensive suits. We felt under-dressed in our jeans and t-shirts. The hotel lobby is tastefully decorated in expensive, elaborate glass vases, tables and light fixtures. The hotel staff were very cordial. One man at the front desk spoke English well and was a big help the 2nd day, calling the airlines for us, because we were waiting to hear about our checked luggage which had been left in Chicago and was supposed to be delivered to us. Our large, attractively decorated corner room was on the 10th floor with panoramic window views of the city and canals (the hotel is situated on a canal which is quite picturesque with benches where you can sit and people watch). The room was clean, although the rug had a couple of dark spots where something had been spilled in the past. We noted that the hotel's website describes some amenities that only certain more expensive rooms must have. Ours had the basics, which was all we needed. The shower tended to go hot/cold, which was annoying. The linens were good quality and heavy, there was a stocked mini fridge and wet bar in the room that had booze, soda, and snacks for sale, and the bed was quite comfortable. Overall, the best part of the stay was the room's view. We took some good photos. Otherwise, for the price, if returning we'd stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “AN EXCELLENT HOTEL IN AN EXCITING CITY”
Reviews.Author: kopakevin
Reviews.Content: We took our 16 Year Old Son & His Friend - to celebrate my 50th. Birthday! Niether my wife or I could fault anyhting - and we have been lucky enough to have travelled all over the world.We ate Japanese on the first night and French ( 2 X MICHELLIN STARS) on the second night - My Birthday. The view from our corner room was "Breathtaking" (15TH FLOOR). It was a very nice, big, well equipped room. The food was outstanding and we will be returning to Amsterdam and this hotel again when we do. The boys were able to do their own thing - even late at night as the city has a "very safe" feel to it. Getting around is easy - walk, take a tram, passanger bicyle ride or take a taxi - whichever you can afford or prefer. An Excellent Short Break !!

Reviews.Title: “A nice 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bdonholidayopinions
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel worth a stay. I stayed there with 2 other colleagues and all three of us enjoyed the hotel location and the great service. All the staff were wonderful and professionals with a permanent welcoming smile. Food was good and accomodating of my colleagu's very fussy eating habits. Definitely recommended for both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beelennicole
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel; the lobby of the hotel has just been renovated as we heard and I have to say it is absolute fantastic and of international standards. The room was spacious, luxurious and stylish decorated; seperate bath tub and shower cabin, extra television in the bathroom and the beds are just great! Dinner in the Ciel Bleu is an absolute must-do! Rated 2 star by Michelin this restaurant belongs to the top of The Netherlands; great food and hospitality and the staff are driven professionals who only go for the best. Do not forget to visit to bar on the 23rd floor, it has been rated the best cocktail bar in The Netherlands and is a real hot spot! Breakfast in the brasserie in the morning was a retreat; a full buffet and a chef in the restaurant to prepare a la carte items upon request. We will definitely come back to this hotel with their friendly and hospitable staff!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: GerjanH
Reviews.Content: We stayed two weeks ago in this wonderful hotel. The newly renovated hotel lobby is looking great. We also had some drinks in the bar on the 23th floor, great service, nice view. The dinner in Ciel bleu was of exceptional quality! The restaurant manager knows exactly what he is doing. The room was clean and the interior was good looking, nice detail are the curtains which opens automaticly when you enter the room. We have never seen such a great bathroom, including TV! It's nice to relax in he healthclub. The ladies at the reception were friendly and helpfull. We stayed in a lot of hotels in Amsterdam, this was the first time in Okura and we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and bland”
Reviews.Author: braveheart_73
Reviews.Content: I was sorely disappointed by the Hotel Okura. I wanted to enjoy it but with a 250 Euro room charge + 30 Euros for breakfast it was extortion for a bland and somewhat dated room and general ambiance. Definitely not worth 5 stars. I was also woken at 6am with an alarm call I didn't book and the cleaner stole the pile of small change I left out half way through my stay - definitely not a tip! The front desk staff were polite but I also had a problem withe the excessive creit card deposit "hold" on my account which fully covered the room and a high level of incidentals.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with verry good (F&B) service.”
Reviews.Author: aanleiding
Reviews.Content: One off the best hotels in Holland. Superb rooms. New lobby. Perfect place tostart your Amsterdam experience

Reviews.Title: “Awful, definitely not value for money”
Reviews.Author: buebck
Reviews.Content: Many problems with this hotel, definitely not a 5 star and not worth the price paid. Rooms were dated and incredibly dirty. Like many of the reviewers have stated, the walls between the rooms were very thin, which made for a very noisy stay. Found that the staff were generally pleasant and friendly, but hapless. In addition, would advise not to use the laundry service, since they damaged several of my items. Finally, there are too many hidden extras as others have mentioned. Breakfast is very expensive, and in addition, there is no free gym/leisure centre or internet, both having ridiculous prices. Avoid this out-of-date, dirty, extortionately priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxury en friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: marjonneke
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our three children in the Okura Hotel on the 29th of april, the day before queensday. We had two connecting rooms which is very pleasant especially with kids and we had a beautifull view over Amsterdam. Before the entrance of the Okura we took the railway nr 25 to the centre of Amsterdam. This line goes every 10 minutes. We've got information about at the reception en we could also buy the tickets in the hotel. The receptionist gave us also very usefull tip what to do at Queensday (teh 30th of april) en how to get there.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great diner and stay!”
Reviews.Author: Happyvisitor84
Reviews.Content: La Serre bar: great service, nice terras Ciel Blue restaurant: great diner, wines en service Rooms: Beautiful, nice and more then comfortabe rooms. Check working airconditioning Overall: great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “best in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Limburger2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed two night with my wife in a exlusive corner room: very exlusive with even a tv in the bathroom. The room was spacious with some extra luxury; turndown sevice, automatic curtains and heated mirrors. The most rewarding was the very friendly staff: no effort was to much. The money was well spend. On the second evening we had diner in the two michelin star restaurant Ciel bleu: i've been to several michelin star rated restaurants but the wine-food combination was one of the best. The view over Amsterdam by night was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rajaspers
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Indulge youself in luxury. The staff was really friendly and helpfull. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but still room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCelt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Okura on several occasions and my wife has attended several conferences held there. First the good. The service is excellent, one could even imagine your were in Tokyo. The Japanese restaurant on the ground floor has a Michelin rosette and is the best Japanese restaurant that I have eaten at within Europe. The sports centre (gym, pool, sauna) is large and luxurious. In addition it is one of the very few conference venues I know which can serve good food to very large numbers. Now the not so good. Some of the rooms are a little dated, with heavy dark furniture. They charge hotel residents extra for access to the sports centre - which I find unacceptable. There is a French style restaurant with two Michelin rosettes on the top floor: it has a fantastic view but I found the food contrived and the experience disappointing. If you want to see the well know tourist sites in Amsterdam the location is not good. On the other hand it is close to the RAI and easily accessible by car.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced - poor location”
Reviews.Author: stephen405
Reviews.Content: The room was of a high quality but feeling slightly dated and a bit bland and not up with the best in class. In Hong Kong it would be being closed for an upgrade. The bed was very comfortable and the room had everything that you would expect of a high qulaity business hotel. We had one meal in the brasserie which was very good although due to lack of customers being a weekend it lacked atmosphere. The restaurant staff were very good though. The hotel is too far out if you are a tourist as its a tram or taxi ride into town and takes about 10-15 mins, though convenient for conference/exhibition centre. The reception staff were poor - it took two attempts to get keys that worked and when asked about the airport shuttle they did not know when it ran. Two things that really annoyed me were the fact that they charged Â£15 per person to use their pool even though we were staying there (that is the first time in 25 years odd of staying in top clas hotels that I have been charged) and their airport shuttle bus is not a shuttle but a private transfer which requires 2 hours notice and is more expensive than a taxi. Somewhere i read that they are trying to be the best hotel in amsterdam - I am afraid that whilst the food may be very good, the location is not great and charging for things that are normally free in any other top class hotel they do not make the grade. There are much better places to stay in amsterdam for business and as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is to much”
Reviews.Author: geenidee
Reviews.Content: Almost every year we have a diner and an overnight for about 130 of our clients in the Okura Hotel. It is not easy to prepare an two Michelin diner for 130 people, but every time it is worth all the Michelin stars that the restaurants in this hotel got. The five hotel stars are deserved and not in the last place because of the frendly and helpful personel.

Reviews.Title: “beware extras”
Reviews.Author: JJoplin
Reviews.Content: The food was excellent and the service very helpful and friendly. We upgraded from the standard room provided (which was rather small with rather tired furnature) to a larger corner room for Â£35/night) . excellent city view with a spectacular view of the fireworks on new years eve. The sound proofing was poor-you could easily hear next door's TV and the lift bells. Beware the extras!! No bottled water in room and Â£7.50p to buy one in the hotel, no tea/coffee making facilities and a Â£6.00 price tag on a cup of coffee in the restaurant. Plenty of parking space but at a cost of Â£35/day and a 10 minute local telephone call that costa Â£10 etc etc. Ok if you are a business traveler on expences -if you are not careful the extras could easily double the headline cost!

Reviews.Title: “Good - but standard rooms are not 5-star quality”
Reviews.Author: chilternwelshman
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Okura for a business conference. I came away with mixed feelings I drove there. It's conveniently located, 5 minutes off the Ring. The hotel has its own good, if expensive, underground car park. Front desk staff were firndly and courteous, and extremely efficient, both on check-in and check-out: could not be faulted. Unlike some other reviewers, I had no difficulties with the housekeeping, room service and restaurant staff. The basic facilities at the hotel are fine, and the restaurants (Ciel Bleu on the 23rd floor, and the Teppanyaki restuaurant on the ground floor are excellent, as are the bars on the 23rd and ground floor. Having said that, the prices match the quality of the experience - far from cheap! Breakfast was good, if a little quirky with breakfast cereals in plastic bottles! Conference facilities and food were well above average. I was in a standard room that was comfortable enough, but a little small, and fast reaching the point where refurbishment will be needed - somewhat tired and faded. There were minor niggles: a shortage of power sockets around the desk; slightly defective sound insulation from the corridor outside; a very small, incredibly narrow, bath ... ... ... all of which made this an experience worth less than the advertised 5 stars, though by no means bad.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel Ive ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: JENNY773
Reviews.Content: I must say that this was the best hotel ive ever stayed in. There wasx porters waiting to assist you as soon as you get there and reception was quick.not too far from centre about 5-10 mins in a tram however the walk is nice.We had an amazing view over the city (if you like that sort of thing see if they have rooms available on one of the higher floors, we were on the 17th floor and i couldn't have asked for a better view) rooms were immaculate and clean and tidied every day, fabulous and modern and plenty of room. It was great opening the curtains by the touch of a button and wake up to that glorious view. very large bathroom with his and hers sinks and an exellent toilet that even clean and dried you ! a fabulous shower that you could even sit down in and big enough for 4 people..and the bath was amazing and had a tv built into the wall, great for them relaxing moments with your favourite alco beverage from the minibar. customer care is very high as when we arrived i had a table booked in one of the restaurants and also a bottle of champagne to be ordered to the room, they knew we didn't check in until 8;00pm and that our table was booked for 9;00pm, however when we got back from the meal they had noticed due to our swipe cards on their computer system and bought the champagne upto the room for us. the restaurants (majority are michellin star) are the best ive ever been to, the panoramic view across amsterdam was amazing from the 24th floor as this is where the french restaurant in the hotel was. the japanese restaurant was exquisit with all of them dressed up in full geisha outfits. the bar in the hotel was fantastic and had a wide varity of any spirit you could want. did not get to go in the tepanyaki restaurant due to it being really popular so it was fully booked, so prebook to avoid disppointment. the shopping mall was brilliant and had a sale on which was even better, i couldn't resist a white burberry london bag which was 60 % off so i treated myself to that, but there was so much nice stuff in the shops so dont forget your plastics!This really is the true meaning of a 5 star hotel and would recommend it to anyone who doesn't mind that little bit extra for quality, However book on easytobook.com to get 60% off the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nell2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Okura hotel in Amsterdam. The staff is very professional and friendly. Our room had a magnificent view over the city. We had dinner in the Yamazato restaurant, which is certainly worth of a recommendation. Breakfast was also good, with plenty of choice. We had booked a promotion with a late check-out on Sunday, which is just a perfect way to have a relaxed weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and poor for business trip”
Reviews.Author: PhilInSuffolk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in order to attend a conference at the RAI centre. The hotel was booked for me by the conference organisers since it was closest to the RAI. They paid for one of the nights, I paid the other 2 and felt well ripped off. I arrived at the hotel by public transport - the tram 25 gets within about 2-300 merres of the hotel. The walk to the hotel entrance takes you through a run down car park with no easy pavement area and could be improved a lot. Check in was fine and quick. The room was generally OK, although rather small, as was the bathroom/toilet. Given that this was only June, and the outside temperature was only about 20C, the air con was verging on ineffective. The room was stuffy, and the window could not be opened far enough. Bed was comfortable. The wardrobe had a bizarre lighting mechanism - open it at the end where there was no hanging rail (just the safe) and the light came on. Open it at the end where the hanging rail was, and the light went off... The worst feature of the room was trying to work there. The desk had no power supply and no Ethernet cable. I had to pull a light plug out of the wall to charge my laptop. There was supposed to be Wireless LAN in the room, but the cost was extortionate and connectivity was poor. Paying over 200 Euros per night, I expect free internet access (as I received in my $99 room the previous week in the USA). Breakfast was similarly heavily over-priced, and we only ate there when it was paid for by the conference company. It's a fair walk to the RAI, and in future I would find a better value hotel with public transport to the centre. Check out was not as slick as it should have been. As stated, bed and breakfast for the first night was paid for, but I had to remind the receptionist of this twice before she accepted it, and then went and printed my bill with the breakfast charge still on it. It came over as another attempt to gouge for more money. Overall - OK location for RAI, OK rooms, poor for business, exceptionally poor value.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing 5 star about the Okura are prices”
Reviews.Author: global8traveler
Reviews.Content: First of all this is an ordinary hotel pretending to be a 5 star establishment - it is far from it except for exorbitant prices. It also extremely unhygienic - two observations during my stay: 1) I was coming back to my room and found it was being serviced â€“ the maid was in the bathroom, she was wearing rubber gloves and had just finished cleaning the bath/shower and toilet. Then, while still wearing those same rubber gloves, she took the used drinking glasses, rinsed them out in the sink and then took the used, dirty towels to dry the glasses. Not only is this unsanitary and poses a health risk, it is disgusting, That also means when you arrive at the hotel, your drinking glasses were wiped dry by the used dirty towels of the previous occupant. When I tried to discuss this with hotel management, they were more concerned that I found out what they do, but other than apologizing they did nothing to provide clean sanitized glasses. 2) During a conference break the waiters were setting up for lunch, one of them was arranging the cutlery using their bare unwashed hands touching the food end of each utensil as they arranged it in neat patterns. Stay away, it is unhygienic, lousy service and way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExeterChris
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a conference package. Pricey but worth it - I was upgraded to a fantastic suite. Pool area first class but hotel guests have to pay - a bit mean I think. Quite a walk from the old town too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, nice room excellent service”
Reviews.Author: relaxed_dude
Reviews.Content: This my first stay here. I am a big fan of the Okura hotel in tokyo. So I thought I would try this out when I on business in Amsterdam for one day. The check in was uneventful. I stayed in a room with two beds and a sofa. Carpets are little worn out. Other than than the rooms are good. The bathroom needs a little renovation too. Nice desk to work on. The lobby is typical Japanese style. Also great location in Amsterdam. I went to the gym in th4e afternoon. They charge extra 15 euros for using the gym, which did not make any sense to me. its a good gym though, with an excellent sauna. I will stay here again, when I am back for business in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “second change for Amsterdam's Okura”
Reviews.Author: MaximillianAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: After me being not to positive in my review fro June 2007 I decided to give the Okura a second change. In order to prevent disappointment I booked a recently renovated deluxe junior suite for â‚¬ 395.00 excluding breakfast. The junior suites are very well decorated; large entrance with a small cloakroom; living room combined with bedroom in which a very nice sofa and some relaxfauteills finish the room. The bed is ok but not as good as the one's in the Marriotts :)! Plus is the mechanisem to close the curtains and switch off / on the lights from your bed! The bathroom is large. well equipt with an extra LCD tv. The promissed rainshower fails the test; unfortunetalyonly small waterpressure is provided. Overall; when you can affort it; go for the Deluxe rooms!, the prices tough are very very high; â‚¬ 5.20 for a normal Coke!?, â‚¬ 29.00 for a very basic continental breakfast!?( full American isn;t available ) the Okura is really pushing it's prices to the point where these kind of prices are getting absurd.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kis777
Reviews.Content: Okura Hotel is located very close to the center, which is convenient. It's a nice clean hotel. Our room had beautiful views of the city. Highlight of the trip was our dinner at the Japanese restaraunt there which was fantastic, perhaps one of the best japanese meals we've ever had. This is a pretty big hotel, so if you prefer privacy that is not the place for you. However, Okura Hotel is a good value and a great hotel to stay at if you are touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, spacious and elegant”
Reviews.Author: ritzB8
Reviews.Content: Hotel Okura is away from the main part of the city. It is not centrally located, but great for honeymooners, business people with meetings at the hotel, etc. We were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary, so it was special. The rooms are spacious and hi-tech. Loved everything about the room and the huge bathroom with double sink overlooking the canal. The bar/lounge overlooks the entire city and the building is the tallest and the highest point in Amsterdam. We didn't get to eat at the hotel restaurants and need to book two weeks in advance, supposedly a 5 star sushi restaurant, and the only 5 stars outside of Japan. There are nearby restaurants, walking distance, but mostly will have to cab it to go to museums, shopping and city center

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business hotel but too far out from center”
Reviews.Author: Wantseverything
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam for New Year with my partner. We got a good deal on a fantastic room in the Okura. We had a suite, which was a good size and nicely decorated. The bathroom was good with a big shower and washlet loo, however the shower leaked. The hotel is too far out to really enjoy the city. It is a good 40min walk. There is a tram close by, but not my idea of fun. The French resturant was closed when we were there so we tried the tappenyaki. We had a set menu (75 euros each), add 2 bottles of average wine, then you are talked (pressurised) into upgrading your beef and before you know it, a meal for 2 costs Â£260. This would be OK, if it was an intimate meal for 2, however you could be sharing your table with a family with small children, as we were. The bar on floor 23 was good, if not a little dated looking but the views of the city are stunning. We only looked around the swimming pool and spa, as I had forgotton my swimming costume. The hotel only had PAPER costumes to purchase for 11.5 euros in a bright flowery pattern. Never have I seen anything more hideous. Why they don't have simple plain black fabric costumes, is beyond me. All in all though the hotel was the best bit of Amsterdam for us.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I didnt work so much so I could appreciate this place”
Reviews.Author: suemyi
Reviews.Content: I used our corporate account and stayed here during my business trip. Far from the shopping and nightlife, but ideal for business travelers. Beautiful facilities, loved the bubble baths while enjoying cheesy US tv shots from the 80's. I am not sure, but I think it was McGuyver...

Reviews.Title: “Okura is average, certainly not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: FlossNY
Reviews.Content: I was curious to see how this hotel would turn out given that previous reviewers either raved about it and recommended the service and excellent staff, or were highly critical and commented on the dated appearance and strange smells! My experience was that both are correct. The staff are very courteous and helpful, there are plenty of amenities and the location is convenient with an easy tram ride into the center of the city and a selection of restaurants and shops within 5 minutes walk. However, my room had the previously reported ' strange smell' (and it was a non-smoking room) and the decor was very 1970s, in the worst sense. Given other reviews, I suspect that there are some more modern renovated rooms and that these are significantly more expensive. I was also disappointed at the premium charges that are slapped on everything, such as internet access (there is WiFi available for 25 Euros per day) and the bar and restaurants are expensive. I certainly would not rate it as a 5 star hotel; more like 3-4 stars. Major renovations are needed to drag it out of the 70s.

Reviews.Title: “Pay per swim!”
Reviews.Author: mimschat
Reviews.Content: I almost booked to go here, but oriented by an earlier review phoned to check if guests could use the swimming pool, only to discover that this would cost an extra 14 Euros, not per stay, but per person, per day!!! So, given I like to swim each evening, we booked elsewhere. I have never, ever stayed in a hotel where you had to pay a day rate to use the pool before! (In fact, the Hilton where I am a member of the gym extended my membership by a month for free as I had a 3 week stay in the hotel, and all facilities are free for guests!)

Reviews.Title: “OK for business, but not for families...”
Reviews.Author: Cleanandquiet
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Hotel Okura in Amsterdam, while on business, on four previous occasions and, in fairness to the hotel, I liked it. For business I found it to be a good hotel - an expensive hotel, but a good one. So, when planning a family trip to Amsterdam I decided to 'treat' us all to an Okura stay opting to pay the premium for the opulence and then the additional premium for one of their executive suites. This led to three sleepless nights and my familiesâ€™ disaffection with the whole â€˜premiumâ€™ hotel experience. The problems started just after midnight on the first night of our stay. Our room, we now know, was directly below the roof top â€˜Ciel Bleu Restaurantâ€™ â€“ or to be more specific, the kitchen of the â€˜Ciel Bleu Restaurantâ€™ (to be pedantic, the tiled floor of the kitchen of the â€˜Ciel Bleu Restaurantâ€™). Between 00:30 and 02:45 on Sunday morning, my wife, our eight year old daughter and I lay in our beds listening to the crash and bash of pots and pans being washed, the clink and chink of glasses and crockery being put away and heavens knows what being repeatedly dragged across the kitchen floor just above our beds. Our complaints were listened to with empathy, but the hotel was fully booked. We were not able to move to another room. We just made breakfast, somewhat bleary eyed, before it stopped service in the morning whereupon we where confronted by another issue. Our daughter would be charged the same rate as an adult for breakfast: Thirty Euros (thatâ€™s Twenty UK Pounds or Forty US Dollars) which has be the most expensive slice of toast, as that is all my daughter ate for breakfast, in any hotel anywhere. Sunday night/Monday morning was not as bad. Perhaps the â€˜Ciel Bleu Restaurantâ€™ had had a quiet night. Anyhow, we got to sleep by around 01:30. My wife decided to skip breakfast in the morning opting for an extra half an hour in bed, but asked that we bring her back a croissant. The staff, however, did not think much of that idea and so we came to the next issue. Despite paying another thirty Euros for my daughterâ€™s slice of toast â€“ that is now sixty Euros (Forty Pounds or Eighty Dollars) - for two slices of toast, they objected to my taking a croissant back to the room. The staff suggested that I pay another Thirty Euros (standard buffet breakfast charge), plus room service charge, to have the croissant delivered to the room. Needless to say that I left the croissant on the breakfast table and my wife went hungry. I will say that as a consequence of this I was now in the dog house â€“ a noisy, expensive dog house â€“ and everything was my fault. So much for a family â€˜treatâ€™! Monday night/Tuesday morning capped the previous two nights. The noise from the kitchen was preceded by the music from the â€˜Champagne and Cocktail Lounge Bar Twenty Thirdâ€™ (our room was on the twenty second floor). Calls to reception finally managed to reduce the din from both the â€˜Champagne and Cocktail Lounge Bar Twenty Thirdâ€™ and the kitchen of the â€˜Ciel Bleu Restaurantâ€™ to a reasonable level, but the occasional accidentally dropped bottle, glass, pot, pan, ladle, cutlery, crockery and who knows what else kept us awake until 03:00. Between 03:00 and 06:30 on Tuesday morning we had a fantastic sleep. Given the option we would have slept longer, but the final issue put pay to that. The â€˜Okura Executive Loungeâ€™, was next to our room and opens at 07:00. The â€˜Okura Executive Loungeâ€™ has a wooden floor. The staff in the â€˜Okura Executive Loungeâ€™ are attractive and pleasant young ladies whose smart uniform includes high heal shoes. High heal shoes and wooden floors are not good bed fellows, if it is your intention to sleep that is. Exasperated I trudged down to reception again â€“ in my pyjamas this time, not a pleasant sight for my fellow guests â€“ and vented my thoughts about the Hotel Okura, the â€˜Ciel Bleu Restaurantâ€™, the â€˜Champagne and Cocktail Lounge Bar Twenty Thirdâ€™ the â€˜Okura Executive Loungeâ€™ and the Sixty Euros for two rounds of toast to the attractive and pleasant young lady whose desk was labelled â€˜Guest Relationsâ€™ and whose smart uniform included high heal shoes. I returned to reception a couple of hours later to check out. The attractive and pleasant lady whose desk was labelled â€˜Guest Relationsâ€™ offered, after listening to my criticisms and much debate, to deduct one nights stay from the bill. It still is a nice hotel and the staff are very nice and efficient. But, the hotel does not understand or cater for children â€“ do not take yours there. Do not pay the extra on top of the extra to stay at this hotel to stay on the Executive floor (the 22nd), you will get no sleep. And finally: you (or at least I) usually leave a hotel with a feeling for its rank; ones own star rating if you will. I left the Hotel Okura Amsterdam with a niggling feeling that its modus operandi was that of a money making machine rather than a luxury hotel - the sort of niggling feeling that makes you think when the staff smile at you that there will be a charge for it on your bill. A bad illustration because, as mentioned, the staff were very nice, but the feeling remains and the hotelâ€™s rank, to my mind, is as a consequence a lowly one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel ..... Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: jordan98
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Okura during a recent trip to Amsterdam to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary. On arrival the Receptionist was very polite and extremely helpful. On learning that it was our Anniversary she arranged an upgrade, free of charge to a Junior Suite. The Bell Boy who took our baggage up was wonderful. When he realised it was our first visit to Amsterdam - he spent approx 15 mins explaining the transport system, showing us the areas to visit and where to find the good restaurants. The room we had was lovely - very large, well decorated, with everything we needed. 30 mins after arriving another Receptionist arrived at the room with a complimentary tray containing flowers, chocolates, a bottle of wine and a hand written note from the General Manager congratulaing us. During our 2 night stay all the staff we dealt with were very pleasent and courteous. We had no complaints at all and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star - Need refurbish”
Reviews.Author: Alvaro_MS
Reviews.Content: This Hotel can NOT be considered as a 5 Star Hotel. The Bathroom was a old fashioned conditioned and the room seems like you were on the 80Â´s. I am Spanish and I am used to go to 3 Star Hotels which are less than half the price of this Hotel and with double quality (Bathroom and room). The Breakfast (almost 30 euro) is expensive and not worth it. This Hotel need to de refurbish!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Tim0210
Reviews.Content: It was a bit pricey - 275 Euro per night. But I got upgraded to a suite, and it was beautiful. It was a corner room that had two big windows. The southern facing window overlooked a canal. the bathroom was very nice too. there's a lot of automation in the room. You can control the curtains, the lights, the alarm clock all from a touch screen console. When it works, it's great. When it doesn't work, it's a pain - like the lights coming on in the middle of the night. I had to unscrew the light bulbs so that I could get some sleep. I like the location. It was in a very quiet part of town, away from all the hustle and bustle. But Amsterdam is a small city, and it doesn't take long to get to where the action is. There is a tram stop very close to the hotel. There's a tram every 15 minutes that takes you to the Dam and the Centraal Station. The Van Gogh museum and the Rijkmuseum are just a leisurely 20 minute walk from the hotel, and a good part of the walk is along a canal on the Hobbemakade Street, so it's very scenic. Be prepared to spend a little extra money in this hotel. Nothing's free. Wireless internet was 25 Euro per day. Local calls 3 Euro. The restaurants in the hotel are very expensive. I paid 75 Euro for a Japanese dinner. Good quality food, but overpriced. Another guest told me that you even had to pay to use the swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Needs imporvement”
Reviews.Author: MattDC
Reviews.Content: 4 nights in April. 2 nights leisure, 2 nights business. Smelly dark lobby. Vey 1970's. Smells like an astray. This is inexcusable in a 5 star hotel. Poor service on arrival - 5 star hotels usually have someone to help you with your bags. Check in was unhelpful - I like information e.g. we have a leisure club and a bar on the top floor. Room key kept failing. Leisure club cost eaxta (but was really excellent). Great delux room room @ Euros 355 per night (cheap plastic bathroom bin though and also own-brand soaps and shampoo's which I think is down market). Japanese restaurant is excellent - but decor is awful 70's. Bar on top floor...drasticlly needs renovation and overhaul. It lacks 'Cool' and style. Boring place - should be an exciting place. Quite unhelpful lobby staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room - outdated lobby”
Reviews.Author: cvanhoesen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in September. The room was spacious, clean and had all of the amenities of a 5 star hotel. It looked like our room had been renovated in the past few years. However, the common areas of this hotel are very outdated. The lobby looks like it was last renovated in the 1970s. The typical patrons of this hotel are business travelers. It is also far from the city center (about a 20 minute walk), so I wouldn't chose this hotel if you are only coming for a weekend. However, since we were in town for a week, we enjoyed the walk to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Was I in same hotel?”
Reviews.Author: staffordshiretrotter
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Okura hotel.Having read several of the earlier reviews I wonder if I have been at the same hotel as some reviewers. Our room was on the 14th floor with a lovely corner view. The room was very clean and comfortable. Our 10 year old daugter had a camp bed onto which was placed a separate supply of toiletries and towels during the turn-down service each night. We wondered why no coffee facilities were available in the room but guessed this was a ploy to charge for room service. We did not eat in the restaurants apart from breakfast, as we had seen the cost of meals and decided to eat in the centre of Amsterdam. Besides, due to the location of the hotel, we found that once we were out for the day it suited us to stay out until the evening, so taking our meals in town. The breakfasts were very good, with lots of choice including the favoured bacon and eggs, as mentioned by other reviewers the champagne is indeed a lovely treat when you are on holiday. I also agree that it is a cheek to charge for use of the pool and gym, but we didnot get chance to use them anyway due to sight-seeing. Although the hotel is not in the centre of Amsterdam, the tram leaves from about 100 yards away and is regular, cheap and friendly. We would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Tam_and_Andrey
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to this hotel from 22-24 March, we had a WONDERFUL time, the bed was soft and comfortable, the bathroom was amazing, and the maids cleaned everything perfectly. We stayed in a standard room, and although the decor was a little dated and the view was the building next door (we were only on the 3rd floor), we still made the most of it and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. On both days we used the spa which was bliss, you get slippers and a robe & towel included in the â‚¬14 fee. There is a sauna, steam room, pool (didn't go in - water too cold!!) and jacuzzi with very comfortable pool-side beds to chill out on. The mini bar was overpriced - â‚¬5 at least for everything, including the water! We just were careful about what we used. We ate breakfast both days and have nothing to moan about, it wasnt amazing but not bad either. We ate in the downstairs restaurant on the 2nd night - not the Japanese one - and although the portions were average the food was AMAZING and the service was top notch. Yes the hotel is away from the centre but we were happy about this - besides, a tram goes from right outside the hotel to the centre and a taxi back late at night will not cost you more than â‚¬12. We ventured into the city to check out the famou red light distrcit - what an experience!!! All in all a WONDERFUL mini break, amazing birthday treat, and 5 star service throughout - apart from the crazy cab driver (we booked the "shuttle" back to the airport for â‚¬25 for the 2 of us, and got a mad, very pierced man in a car driving like a maniac and texting the whole time to the airport. Needless to say I am glad we made it there in one piece!!). The other downside was the 8 hour flight delay to get back to London (a 50 minute flight!!) - but that was booked through easyjet and is a whole other story!!!!! If you go - enjoy! They are renovating at the moment but we weren't bothered by this at all.

HotelInfo.Name: Okura Amsterdam Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, Amsterdam 1072 LH, The Netherlands
